column1: In September 1988, during the 20th anniversary celebration of Evergreen Marine Corporation's founding, company chairman Chang Yung-fa announced his company's intentions to establish Taiwan's first private international airline.
column2: 1988 年 9 月，為慶祝長榮海運創辦二十周年，長榮公司董事長張榮發宣布，該公司將創辦台灣第一家民間創立的國際航空公司。

column1: The opportunity to create a major Taiwanese airline had just arisen following a decision by the Taiwanese government to liberalise the country's air transportation system.
column2: 在台灣政府實施空運系統自由化後，就有機會可以創造一家台灣主要航空公司。

column1: Government requirements still mandated global experience and financial capital requirements for any company seeking permission to initiate international airline service from Taiwan.
column2: 但在台灣要成立一家國際航空公司，政府仍然要求必須具備國際經驗與財力。

column1: Upon receipt of regulatory approval, EVA Airways Corporation was formally established in March 1989.
column2: 在取得監管單位批准後，長榮航空正式於 1989 年 3 月成立。

column1: The airline was originally to be called Evergreen Airways, however this was deemed too similar to the unrelated Evergreen International cargo airline.
column2: 長榮航空的英文公司名稱原本為 Everygreen Airways，但是這和不相關的 Evergreen International 空運公司過於接近。

column1: In October 1989, the newly formed EVA Airways Corporation placed a US$3.6 billion order for 26 aircraft from Boeing and McDonnell Douglas, including Boeing 747-400 and MD-11 airliners.
column2: 1989 年 10 月，新成立的長榮航空，以 36 億美元向波音與麥道公司訂購 26 架飛機，包括波音 747-400 型與 MD-11。

column1: Operations began on 1 July 1991 with a small fleet of Boeing 767-300ER aircraft featuring business and economy class seating.
column2: 1991 年 7 月 1 日以小型的波音 767-300ER 客機正式開始營運，附有商務艙與經濟艙。

column1: Initial destinations from Taipei were Bangkok, Seoul, Jakarta, Singapore, and Kuala Lumpur.
column2: 初期的航線包括台北飛曼谷、首爾、雅加達、新加坡、吉隆坡。

column1: By the end of the year, the EVA Air network had expanded to include additional cities in East Asia and its first European destination, Vienna.
column2: 該年年底時，長榮航空航線已擴及東亞多個城市，以及在歐洲的第一個據點維也納。

column1: First year revenues reached US$40 million.
column2: 頭一年的營收達 4000 萬美元。

column1: In 1992, EVA Air received the first of its Boeing 747-400 aircraft on order, and launched its premium economy class, "Economy Deluxe", on its 747 transpacific flights to Los Angeles, beginning in December of that year.
column2: 1992 年，長榮航空訂購的第一架波音 747-400 型飛機交機，同時於該年 12 起在飛往洛杉磯的 747 航班中推出豪華經濟艙。

column1: EVA Air's premium economy cabin was the first in the world featured a wider 2-4-2 abreast configuration, legrests, individual seatback video, and enhanced meal services.
column2: 長榮航空的豪華經濟艙，全球率先採用加寬 2-4-2 並排座位，提供腿靠、個人椅背影音、高級餐點服務。

column1: EVA Air's Economy Deluxe cabin (later renamed "Evergreen Deluxe" and "Elite Class") proved popular with the traveling public.
column2: 長榮航空的豪華經濟艙（之後更名為「長榮豪華艙」與「菁英艙」），廣受旅客好評。

column1: For international services, EVA Air's 747s were configured with 104 premium economy seats as part of a 370-seat, four-class cabin, in addition to first, business and economy classes.
column2: 在國際航線，長榮的 747 設定有四種座艙，共有 370 席，除了頭等艙、商務艙和經濟外，豪華經濟艙有 104 席。

column1: In 1993, EVA Air added flights to Seattle, New York, Bangkok and Vienna with the Boeing 747-400.
column2: 1993 年，長榮航空 747-400 型的航點增加西雅圖、紐約、曼谷、維也納。

column1: By 1994, EVA Air was providing regular service to 22 destinations worldwide, and carrying over 3 million passengers annually.
column2: 1994 年時，長榮航空的全球定期航線共有 22 個航點，每年乘客人數超過 300 萬人。

column1: In 1995, the airline posted its first profit on revenues of US$1.05 billion, one year ahead of schedule.
column2: 1995 年，長榮航空首次轉虧為盈，營收達 10.5 億美元，較預期提前一年。

column1: Internationally, EVA Air's rapid expansion and increased passenger volume was boosted by its safety record, in contrast to its primary competitor, China Airlines.
column2: 長榮航空由於優異的飛安記錄，特別是和主要競爭者華航相比，因此能夠在國際線上快速擴張，吸引大量乘客。

column1: In addition to receiving IOSA (IATA Operational Safety Audit) certification, EVA Air in 1997 achieved simultaneous official ISO 9002 certification in the areas of Passenger, Cargo, and Maintenance Services.
column2: 除了獲得 IOSA ( IATA 營運安全稽核）認證之外，1997 年長榮航空同時在客運、貨運與維修服務得到 ISO 9002 認證。

column1: Dedicated EVA Air Cargo operations began in April 1995, with the first weekly McDonnell Douglas MD-11 freighter flights to Taipei, Singapore, Penang, San Francisco, New York, and Los Angeles.
column2: 長榮的貨運專機於 1995 年 4 月開始營運，開始時使用 MD-11 型飛機，每週飛往台北、新加坡、檳城、舊金山、紐約、洛杉磯。

column1: EVA Air Cargo's fleet was expanded to five freighters by the end of the year.
column2: 該年年終時，長榮貨機機隊的規模增加到五架貨機。

column1: Previously, EVA Air Cargo operations mainly relied on passenger aircraft cargo space.
column2: 之前，長榮航空的貨運業務，主要以客機貨艙的空間來營運。

column1: In the mid–1990s, EVA Air expanded into the domestic Taiwan market by acquiring shares in Makung International Airlines, followed by Great China Airlines and Taiwan Airways.
column2: 在 1990 年代中期，長榮航空購供了馬公航空、大華航空與台灣航空，擴大在台灣國內市場的份量。

column1: On 1 July 1998, all three carriers, as well as EVA's existing domestic operations, merged under the UNI Air title.
column2: 1998 年 7 月 1 日，上述三家航空公司，與長榮航空的國內線業務，合併為立榮航空。

column1: UNI Air became EVA Air's domestic intra-Taiwanese subsidiary, operating short haul flights out of its base in Kaohsiung, Taiwan's southern port and second-largest city.
column2: 立榮航空成為長榮航空專飛台灣國內航線的子公司，總部設於位於台灣南端的第二大城高雄，專飛短程航線。

column1: In 2000, EVA Air embarked on its first major long-haul fleet renewal.
column2: 2000 年時，立榮航空更新機隊，開始飛行主要長程航線。

column1: The airline became one of the launch customers for the Boeing 777-300ER, ordering four aircraft plus eight options.
column2: 長榮航空也是首家提供波音 777-300ER 型客機服務的公司，訂購四架該型飛機，並保留八架的訂單。

column1: At the same time, the airline placed three orders for the Boeing 777-200LR.
column2: 同時該公司也訂購了三架波音 777-200LR 型。

column1: In January 2001, EVA Air ordered its first Airbus aircraft, the A330-200.
column2: 2001 年 1 月，長榮航空首次訂購第一架空中巴士飛機，型號為 A330-200。

column1: The Boeing 777 aircraft were intended for United States and European services, while the Airbus A330 aircraft were intended for regional Asian routes.
column2: 該公司以波音 777 飛行美國與歐洲航線，空中巴士 A330 則執飛亞洲航線。

column1: In 2001, EVA Air began listing public stock offerings on the Taiwan Stock Exchange.
column2: 2001 年，長榮航空股票開始在台灣證券交易所上架交易。

column1: Initially, one percent of the company's shares was offered over-the-counter, with one-quarter held by parent company Evergreen Marine Corporation and EVA Air employees, respectively.
column2: 一開始時，僅有 1% 的該公司股票在市場上流通，母公司長榮海運和長榮航空的員工，各自持有四分之一股份。

column1: In 2002, EVA Air underwent internal corporate reforms, with staff reductions and streamlined management.
column2: 2002 年，長榮航空進行內部企業重整，進行裁員並簡化管理。

column1: This culminated a process which had begun in 1997, when the Asian financial crisis began affecting profitability.
column2: 改革從 1997 年就開始，而在亞洲金融風暴開始影響其獲利時達到最高峰。

column1: The 2002–2003 SARS contagion also affected passenger traffic for medium-haul flights in Southeast Asia, while long-haul flights to North America, Japan, and Europe were less affected.
column2: 2002－2003 年間的 SARS 疫情，同時也影響到其東南亞中程航線的載客率，飛往北美、日本和歐洲的長途班機比較未受影響。

column1: In 2004, EVA Air converted its remaining eight options for Boeing 777-300ERs into firm orders.
column2: 2004 年，長榮航空把保留的八張波音 777-300ER 訂單轉為確認訂單。

column1: The first Boeing 777-300ER entered service as EVA Air's new flagship aircraft in July 2005.
column2: 首架波音 777-300ER，於 2005 年 7 月成為長榮航空的新旗艦機。

column1: With the arrival of its new Boeing 777s, EVA Air launched a comprehensive revamp of its cabins, introducing lie-flat seats in its new Premium Laurel business class cabin, and upgrading its premium economy product to the new Elite Class cabin.
column2: 在新的波音 777 交機時，長榮航空也對座艙進行大更新，在新推出的桂冠商務艙中引進可平躺的座椅，亦將其豪華經濟艙升級為新的菁英艙。

column1: The airline's A330s were introduced with two-class Premium Laurel and Economy cabins.
column2: 該公司也引進擁有桂冠艙與經濟艙兩種艙等的 A330 客機。

column1: In December 2005, EVA Air and its associated divisions had 5,098 employees, and the airline's network spanned 40 passenger destinations worldwide, with additional cargo destinations.
column2: 2005 年 12 月，長榮航空與旗下事業體共有 5,098 名員工，飛航路線擴及全球 40 個城市，以及額外的貨運航點。

column1: In 2007, EVA Air announced a nonstop Taipei to New York (John F. Kennedy International Airport) service, to be operated with its new long-range Boeing 777-300ERs.
column2: 2007 年，長榮航空推出台北直飛紐約（約翰甘迺迪國際機場）航線，以新加入的波音 777-300ER 長程客機執飛。

column1: At the same time, the airline withdrew passenger service from Taipei to Paris.
column2: 同時，該公司取消台北飛巴黎的客機航線。

column1: On 31 October 2008, EVA Air announced a resumption of Taipei to Paris service with twice-weekly passenger flights beginning 21 January 2009.
column2: 2008 年 10 月 31 日，長榮航空宣布重啟台北巴黎航線，自 2009 年 1 月 21 日起每兩周一班客機。

column1: In 2008, the airline also announced the suspension of services to Auckland.
column2: 2008 年，該公司宣布暫停奧克蘭航線服務。

column1: The carrier also prepared to increase direct flights to China, after initiating weekly charter flights in July 2008 following changes to the Three Links travel agreements.
column2: 該公司也在「三通」旅行協定放寬後，先於 2008 年啟動中國航線每周包機，接著準備增加直飛航線。

column1: For the 2007–2008 period, EVA Air coped with a 34% surge in fuel prices, which contributed to a US$61.2 million 2007 loss.
column2: 2007-2008 期間，長榮航空面對燃油價格大漲 34%，造成 2007 年間 6120 萬美元的虧損。

column1: In August 2008, EVA Air reported a second quarterly loss due to increased fuel costs.
column2: 2008 年 8 月，長榮航空發表第二季虧損報告，原因在於燃料成本上升。

column1: In response, the airline implemented cost-saving measures, including flight schedule reductions and fee increases.
column2: 因此該公司發動節約成本行動，包括取消部分班次、提高費率等。

column1: In early 2008, EVA Air's business office in El Segundo, California, announced a major staff reduction, with over half the staff advised that they would no longer be employed by May 2008.
column2: 2008 年初，長榮航空位於美國加州瑟袞多的辦事處宣布大裁員，超過一半的雇員接獲通知，將於 2008 年 5 月停職。

column1: Functions performed by those local staff were shifted to Taiwan by half, such as the reservation center.
column2: 半數由當地人員執行的業務移回台灣，例如訂票中心。

column1: EVA Air carried 6.2 million passengers in 2007, and employed 4,800 staff members as of April 2008. The carrier returned to profitability in the first quarter of 2009, with a US$5.9 million net gain.
column2: 2007 年長榮航空共運載 620 萬名乘客，在 2008 年 4 月時有員工 4,800 人。2009 年第 1 季，該公司轉虧為盈，淨利達 590 萬美元。

column1: In August 2010, EVA Air was named one of the top 10 international airlines in Travel+Leisure's World's Best Awards.
column2: 2010 年 8 月，長榮航空獲選為全球最佳休閒旅遊的十大國際航空公司獎項。

column1: In March 2010, EVA Air began services to Toronto.
column2: 2010 年，長榮航空新增多倫多航點。

column1: In November 2010, EVA Air began nonstop flights connecting the inner-city Taipei Songshan and Tokyo Haneda airports.
column2: 2010 年 11 月，長榮航空開始提供台北松山機場直飛東京羽田機場服務。

column1: In 2010, Chang Kuo-wei, son of Chang Yung-fa, returned to serve as EVA Air's president, and the carrier recorded increased sales and yearly profits.
column2: 2010 年，張榮發之子張國煒回任長榮航空總裁，該公司同時再創年營收與獲利新高。

column1: In early 2011, the carrier announced that it had applied for airline alliance membership with Star Alliance, and later that year clarified that it was in talks to join either Oneworld or Star Alliance by 2013.
column2: 2011 年初，該公司宣布已申請加入星空聯盟，但於同年稍晚澄清說正在討論於 2013 年加入星空聯盟或寰宇一家聯盟。

column1: In June 2011, the carrier began nonstop flights from Taipei to Guam, and in October 2011 the carrier announced nonstop service from New York (JFK) to Taipei.
column2: 2011 年 6 月，該公司開始台北關島直飛航線，並於 2011 年宣布將提供紐約 JFK 機場直飛台北航班。

column1: On 27 March 2012, EVA Air announced that it would join Star Alliance in 2013.
column2: 2012 年 3 月 27 日，長榮航空宣布將於 2013 年加入星空聯盟。

column1: On 24 September 2012 EVA Air signed a partnership with Amadeus IT Group Altéa suite for its Altéa Revenue Management system.
column2: 2012 年 9 月 24 日，長榮航空與 Amadeus IT Group Altéa 套裝軟體簽定合作協議，以使用其 Altéa 營收管理系統。

column1: On 18 June 2013, EVA Air became a full member of Star Alliance.
column2: 2013 年 6 月 18 日，長榮航空成為星空聯盟的正式成員。

column1: In October 2014, EVA AIR announced its intention to expand its North American network by adding new routes to Houston in 2015 and Chicago in 2016, along with expanding 55 flights per week to 63 flights per week to North America.
column2: 2014 年 10 月，長榮航空宣布計畫擴增北美飛航網，將於 2015 年飛休士頓、2016 年飛芝加哥，每周飛往北美的班機，將由 55 班增加至 63 班。

column1: In October 2015, EVA AIR announced its intent to purchase up to 24 Boeing 787 Dreamliners and two additional 777-300ER (Extended Range) jetliners from Boeing.
column2: 2015 年 10 月，長榮航空宣布將增購多達 24 架波音 787 夢幻客機，並新購 2 架增程型波音 777-300ER 噴射客機。

column1: EVA Airways will join the 787-10 launch customer team.
column2: 長榮航空也將成為 787-10 型的首批顧客之一。

column1: In November 2015, EVA Air unveiled a new livery on its 22nd Boeing 777-300ER.
column2: 2015 年 11 月，長榮航空公布其第 22 架波音 777-300ER 的新塗裝。

column1: In January 2016, Evergreen Group chairman Chang Yung-fa died, leaving control of the company to his son by his second marriage, Chang Kuo-Wei.
column2: 2016 年 1月，長榮集團總裁張榮發去世，將該公司的控制權留給二房子張國煒。

column1: In March 2016, a coup by the three children of Chang Yung-fa's first marriage removed Chang Kuo-Wei as chairman and replaced him with Lin Pang-Shui (Steven Lin).
column2: 2016 年 3 月，由張榮發長房三個兒子組成的團體，迫使張國煒離任董事長，由林寶水 (Steven Lin) 接任。

column1: Chang Kuo-Wei later established a new airline separate from EVA Air, called StarLux Airlines.
column2: 張國煒離開長榮航空後，新成立星宇航空。

column1: In June 2016, EVA Air was one of eleven airlines to be given a Skytrax 5-star rating, along with All Nippon Airways, Asiana Airlines, Cathay Pacific, Etihad Airways, Garuda Indonesia, Hainan Airlines, Japan Airlines, Lufthansa, Qatar Airways and Singapore Airlines.
column2: 2016 年 6 月，長榮航空獲 Skytrax 評選為 11 家五星級航空公司之一，其他包括全日空、韓亞航空、國泰航空、阿提哈德航空、嘉魯達印尼航空、海南航空、日本航空、漢莎航空、卡達航空與新加坡航空。

column1: On 24 August 2017, EVA Air unveiled its third-generation uniform, designed by fashion house Shiatzy Chen.
column2: 2017 年 8 月 24 日，長榮航空發表第三代制服，由流行設計品牌夏姿操刀。

column1: Those new uniforms were rolled out in November 2017, replacing the second generation uniform that was introduced in 2003.
column2: 新制度於 2017 年 11 月換裝，替換掉於 2003 年推出的第二代制服。

column1: On 2 October 2018, EVA Air took delivery of its first of four Boeing 787-9 Dreamliners.
column2: 2018 年 10 月 2 日，長榮航空進行首批四架波音 787-9 夢幻客機遞交。

column1: The airline has orders for 20 787-10s and options for six more.
column2: 該公司訂購 20 台 787-10 型，另保留 6 台訂單。

column1: In June 2019, EVA Air took delivery of its first of twenty Boeing 787-10 Dreamliners.
column2: 2019 年 6 月，長榮航空完成二十架訂單中首架波音 787-10 夢幻客機交機。

column1: On 20 June 2019, Taiwan Flight Attendants Union (TFAU) started an air strike.
column2: 2019 年 6 月 20 日，桃園市空服員職業工會 (TFAU)發動空服員罷工。

column1: EVA Air and Taiwan Flight Attendants reached an agreement on 7 July 2019 stating that the strike will end on 10 July 2019.
column2: 2019 年 7 月 7 日，長榮航空與桃園市空服員職業工會達成協議，罷工將於 2019 年 7 月 10 日結束。

column1: About 1440 flights are cancelled and more than 280,000 passengers are affected from the air strike.
column2: 該次罷工造成 1440 架次航班被迫取消，280,000 位旅客受到影響。

column1: The strike lasted from 20 June 2019 to 10 July 2019 which lasted from 17 days, the longest strike in Taiwan history.
column2: 該次罷工由 2019 年 6 月 20 日進行至 2019 年 7 月 10 日，歷時 17 天，是台灣史上最長的罷工事件。

column1: The airline estimates a prospective loss of about US$97 million as a result of the strike.
column2: 該公司估計這次罷工造成約 9700 萬美元的損失。

column1: As of 2011, EVA Air's corporate leadership is headed by Chairman Lin Bou-shiu and President Cheng Chuan-yi.
column2: 2011 年時，長榮航空公司的高層為董事長林寶水、總裁鄭傳義。

column1: EVA Air's president plays a primary role in managing EVA's business operations.
column2: 長榮航空總裁主導該公司的業務營運管理。

column1: Other members of EVA Air's board manage support and service services of the company, including its catering and maintenance divisions.
column2: 長榮航空董事會的其他成員，協助管理該公司的其他服務，如餐飲與維修部門。

column1: Related areas outside EVA Air's direct management include UNI Holidays, Evergreen's Evasión travel service and Evergreen Laurel Hotels.
column2: 長榮航空直屬之外的其他相關領域，包括立榮假期、長榮假期 Evasion 與長榮桂冠酒店。

column1: EVA Air has its headquarters, known as the EVA Air Building, in Luzhu, Taoyuan City.
column2: 長榮航空總部位於桃園市蘆竹區的長榮航空大樓。

column1: EVA Air is largely privately owned.
column2: 長榮航空絕大部分由私人持有。

column1: Primary shareholders are Evergreen Marine Corporation (20%), Evergreen founder Chang Yung-fa (15%), and Evergreen International Corporation (11%).
column2: 最大股東為長榮海運 (20%)、長榮集團創辦人張榮發 (15%)、長榮國際公司 (11%)。

column1: Foreign investors and individual stockholders combined hold 28% of EVA Air shares.
column2: 長榮航空的境外投資人與個人投資持股，合計占 28%。

column1: EVA Air has differentiated its onboard service by using Taiwanese (Hokkien), Mandarin, Hakka, English, and other languages for its in-flight cabin announcements.
column2: 長榮航空的機內座艙廣播分為台語、國語、客語、英語及其他語言。

column1: The order of Hokkien and Mandarin has varied since the carrier's launch.
column2: 台語與國語的使用順序，在該公司成立後曾經變動過。

column1: EVA Air has also used Taiwanese folk songs in its boarding music, including an orchestral form of "Longing for Spring Wind" performed by the Evergreen Group's Evergreen Symphony Orchestra.
column2: 長榮航空也在登機音樂中使用台灣民謠，包括管絃樂版「望春風」，由長榮集團所屬的長榮交響樂團演奏。

column1: The carrier's aircraft and employee color scheme has at times been interpreted by observers as support for the Pan-Green Coalition of Taiwanese politics, mainly due to Evergreen founder Chang Yung-fa's political views in the 2000 presidential election, but this association changed following Chang's support of the Pan-Blue Coalition in the 2004 presidential election.
column2: 該公司的飛機與員工制服配色，長久以來被外界視為對台灣政界泛綠陣營的支持，主要因為長榮集團創辦人張榮發在 2000 年總統選舉中的政治傾向；但這種關聯在 2004 年總統選舉時張改支持泛藍陣營時發生改變。

column1: The carrier has further abstained from displaying official markings of Taiwan on its aircraft, and received expedited approval of international landing rights as a result.
column2: 該公司也避免在其班機機身上使用台灣的官方圖像，以加速獲取國際降落許可。

column1: The name "EVA" was taken from two letters of "Evergreen" and the first letter of "Airways." The name "EVA" is always spelled in capital letters and is pronounced "E-V-A".
column2: 長榮航空的英文名稱「EVA」來自「Evergreen」與「Airways」二字中的首字母。「EVA」均以大寫字母拼寫，且發音為「E-V-A」。

column1: The airline uses the logo of its parent company, using green with an orange trim.
column2: 該公司沿用母公司綠色加上橙帶的商標。

column1: The standard EVA Air livery utilizes dark green, signifying durability, and orange, representing technological innovation.
column2: 長榮航空的標準塗裝使用強調恒久的暗綠色，以及象徵科技創新的橙色。

column1: The tail globe logo is intended to represent stability and reliability, and its positioning on the tail, with one corner off the edge, represents service innovation.
column2: 其機尾標誌是要呈現穩定與信賴感，其在尾翼上的配置有一邊缺角，表現的是服務創新的精神。

column1: The EVA Air livery was updated in 2002, adding a larger typeface and the use of green covering the aircraft below the window line.
column2: 2002 年長榮航空更新塗裝，字體放大，窗框以下的機體塗滿綠色。

column1: The tail design and logo remained unchanged.
column2: 機尾設計與標誌沒有異動。

column1: In late 2015, EVA Air redesigned the livery and tail logo, using the dark green color on the belly, and cancelled the orange line on the edge of the tail to highlight the corporate identity.
column2: 2015 年，長榮航空重新設計塗裝與機尾標誌，在機腹使用暗綠綠色，機尾邊框的橙色線條也取消，以強化企業識別。

column1: Since 2003, EVA Air has adopted its current uniform, featuring dark green dresses with cropped jackets.
column2: 長榮航空的現有制服自 2003 年啟用，以暗綠色上衣搭配短夾克。

column1: Chief pursers are distinguished by orange highlights, gold bands, and orange stripes; flight attendants feature green trim and white stripes.
column2: 事務長則以橙色強調身分，加上金色飾邊和橙帶；機組人員另以綠色剪裁與白色飾帶識別。

column1: The name Pingtung refers to a former nearby mountain known as Half-Screen Mountain (Chinese: 半屏山; Pe̍h-ōe-jī: Pòaⁿ-pêng-soaⁿ).
column2: 屏東之名來自附近的半屏山。

column1: Pingtung means "East of Half-Screen Mountain."
column2: 屏東意為「半屏山之東」。

column1: After two incidents in which Dutch sailors were killed by the aboriginal inhabitants of Liuqiu Island, in Spring 1636, a punitive campaign was carried out by Dutch sailors which became known as the Lamey Island Massacre.
column2: 在發生兩次荷蘭水手遭小琉球當地原位民殺害事件後，1636 年春，荷蘭水手發動一次復仇行動，史稱「拉美島屠殺事件」。

column1: Modern-day Pingtung County and Kaohsiung City were part of Banlian-chiu (萬年州; Bān-liân-chiu) during the Kingdom of Tungning (1661–1683) and Fongshan Prefecture (鳳山縣; Hōng-soaⁿ-koān) during Qing dynasty rule (1683–1895).
column2: 現在的屏東縣和高雄市，在 1661 年到 1683 年東寧王國期間，是在萬年州轄下；1683 年到 1895 年清代統治期間則由鳳山縣管轄。

column1: Pingtung County is a recently developed county.
column2: 屏東縣的發展是自近代啟動。

column1: Its largest city is Pingtung City.
column2: 其最大城市為屏東市。

column1: Until the seventeenth century, this area of Taiwan was a place of exile for Chinese criminals and occasional landing point for international mariners.
column2: 在 17 世紀之前，台灣這個區域主要都是流亡中國罪犯逃亡處，偶而也會有外國船員登陸。

column1: Only the settlements near present-day Checheng Township existed.
column2: 當時的居處，現在只有車城鄉還留存。

column1: In 1664, the Hakka settlers arrived from mainland China and farmed under a homesteading system introduced by Zheng Jing.
column2: 1664 年客家移民自中國大陸移居，在鄭經設置的戶口制度下開墾。

column1: Pingtung City, the biggest city in Pingtung County, also known as "A-Kau" (阿猴; A-kâu), was the home of Taiwanese Plains Aborigines.
column2: 屏東市是屏東縣最大的城市，舊名阿猴，是當時台灣平埔族的部落。

column1: In their language, "A-kau" means "the forest".
column2: 在平埔語中，「阿猴」是森林之意。

column1: The first settlements by Han Chinese people were not established until 1684 with the creation of villages near Pingtung by people from China's southern Fujian region.
column2: 第一個漢人聚落在 1684 年興起，由自中國南方福建省的移民，在屏東附近建立。

column1: By 1734 most of the Pingtung Plain was cultivated and in 1764 Pingtung was expanded.
column2: 1734 年時，屏東平原大部分地區都已開墾，1764 年屏東的範圍也擴大了。

column1: In 1836, the government and locals worked together to build the four walls of the city (the North gate, the East gate, the West gate and the South gate), and the roads were also properly finished.
column2: 1836 年在官民合作下設立四個城牆（北門、東門、西門、南門），也修好道路。

column1: In March 1867, 14 American sailors were killed near Kenting by local aborigines in the Rover Incident, which lead to the American Formosa Expedition three months later.
column2: 1867 年 3 月，14 個美國船員在墾丁附近，遭到當地原住民殺害，是為羅妹號事件；造成美國在三個月後出兵台灣。

column1: In 1871, 54 sailors from Ryukyu were killed by local aborigines in the Mudan Incident.
column2: 1871 年，54 名琉球船員遭當地原住民殺害，是為牡丹社事件。

column1: The Japanese carried out a punitive campaign against the local aborigines in the Japanese invasion of Taiwan (1874).
column2: 1874 年，日本入侵台灣，發動討伐當地原住民的復仇行動。

column1: Under Japanese rule (1895–1945), Hōzan Subprefecture (Japanese: 鳳山支廳) was initially under Tainan Ken (臺南縣), but political divisions changed frequently between 1895 and 1901.
column2: 日治時期 (1895-1945)，台南縣下轄鳳山支廳，但行政區畫在 1895 到 1901 年間變動頻繁。

column1: In 1901, Akō Chō (阿猴廳) was established.
column2: 1901 年設立阿猴廳。

column1: In 1909, the name was modified to Akō Chō (阿緱廳).
column2: 1909 年更名為阿緱廳。

column1: In 1920, the name was changed to Heitō City (屏東市) and was administered under Takao Prefecture, which consisted of modern-day Pingtung County and Kaohsiung.
column2: 1920 年，更名為屏東市，由高雄縣管轄，包括今之屏東縣與高雄市。

column1: After the handover of Taiwan from Japan to the Republic of China on 25 October 1945, the area of present-day Pingtung County was incorporated to Kaohsiung County on 25 December 1945.
column2: 1945 年 10 月 25 日，日本將台灣交還中華民國後，現今屏東縣轄區在 1945 年 12 月 25 日畫入高雄縣。

column1: On 16 August 1950, Pingtung County was established after being separated from Kaohsiung County.
column2: 1950 年 8 月 16 日，屏東自高雄分出，獨立設縣。

column1: On 1 December 1951, Pingtung City was downgraded from provincial city to county-controlled city and county seat of Pingtung County.
column2: 1951 年 12 月 1 日，屏東市由省轄市降格為縣轄市，由屏東縣管理。

column1: Pingtung was the site of an 7.1 magnitude earthquake on 26 December 2006.
column2: 2006 年 12 月 26 日，屏東發生規模 7.1 的地震。

column1: In 2009, Pingtung received rainfall in excess of 2,500 millimetres (98 in); breaking all rainfall records of any single place in Taiwan induced by a single typhoon.
column2: 2009 年，屏東的年降雨量超過 2,500 毫米（98英寸），打破台灣各地由單一颱風引發的降雨記錄。

column1: With a land area of over 2,775 km² (1,071 sq mi), Pingtung is the fifth largest county in Taiwan, the second largest of Southern Taiwan after Kaohsiung City. Geographically it borders Kaohsiung City to the north, Taitung County to the east, the Taiwan Strait to the west and the Bashi Channel to the south.
column2: 屏東面積達 2,775 平方公里（1,071平方英哩），是台灣第五大縣，也是南台灣僅次於高雄市的第二大行政區。地理上北方與高雄市接壤，東為台東縣，西邊是台灣海峽，南臨巴士海峽。

column1: Islands administered by the county include Hsiao Liuchiu (Lamay Islet; 琉球嶼) and Qixingyan (Seven Star Reefs; 七星岩).
column2: 該縣管轄的離島包括小琉球、七星岩。

column1: Pingtung City is the county seat of Pingtung County which houses the Pingtung County Government and Pingtung County Council.
column2: 屏東市為屏東縣治所在地，屏東縣政府與縣議會設立於此。

column1: The county is headed by Magistrate Pan Men-an of the Democratic Progressive Party.
column2: 縣長為民主進步黨籍的潘孟安。

column1: Pingtung County elected three Democratic Progressive Party legislators to the Legislative Yuan during the 2016 legislative election.
column2: 在 2016 年的立法委員選舉中，屏東選出三位民進黨籍立委。

column1: As of 2015, Pingtung County has the third highest number of registered temples at 1,101 after Tainan and Kaohsiung.
column2: 截至 2015 年，屏東縣內註冊有 1,101 間寺廟，為全國第三多，僅次於台南和高雄。

column1: The economy of Pingtung County has been traditionally dominated by agriculture and fishery industries.
column2: 屏東縣的經濟，傳統上以農業與漁業為主。

column1: However, the Pingtung County Government has been greatly promoting the tourism sector of the county in recent years.
column2: 不過，屏東縣政府近年來大力推動觀光旅遊產業。

column1: Currently, tourism sector in the county contributes to 30% of the tourism industry in Taiwan.
column2: 現今該縣觀光旅遊業的產值，佔全台灣 30%。

column1: In February 2014, the county government announced a plan to develop an industrial center which consists of a service center, workshop and performance venue.
column2: 2014 年，縣政府宣布計畫，將發展一座包括服務中心、工作區與表演場館的產業園區。

column1: This was aimed to promote the development of industries that leverage the unique cultural attributes of the Linali tribe.
column2: 目標為推動以禮納里部落獨特文化相關產業的發展。

column1: On 22 September 2015, the National Development Council revealed a three-year large-scale development plan to boost the economy of the county by transforming Dapeng Bay, Donggang Township and Lamay Island into a fishery, recreational and tourism hub.
column2: 2015 年 9 月 22 日，國發會發表一項三年大型發展計畫，將大鵬灣、東港鎮與小琉球轉變為漁業、休閒與旅遊中心，以加速地方經濟發展。

column1: Pingtung County houses Taiwan's third nuclear power plant, the Maanshan Nuclear Power Plant.
column2: 台灣第三座核能電廠馬鞍山核能發電廠，位在屏東。

column1: The power plant is located in Hengchun Township and is Taiwan's second largest nuclear power plant in terms of its capacity at 2 X 890 MW.
column2: 台灣第二大的核能電廠位於恆春鎮，共有兩部 890 MW 發電機組。

column1: The Pingtung Line and South-Link Line of the Taiwan Railways Administration lines cross Pingtung County, consist of Central Signal, Chaozhou, Donghai, Fangliao, Fangshan, Fangye Signal, Guilai, Jiadong, Jialu, Kanding, Linbian, Linluo, Liukuaicuo, Nanzhou, Neishi, Pingtung, Xishi, Zhen'an and Zhutian Station.
column2: 台鐵屏東線與南迴線穿越屏東縣境，共有中央號誌、潮州、東海、枋寮、枋山、麟洛、六塊厝、南州、內獅、屏東、西勢、鎮安與竹田等火車站。

column1: The Pingtung Line links Pingtung County with Kaohsiung City, while the South-Link Line links Pingtung County with Taitung County.
column2: 屏東線連接屏東縣與高雄市，南迴線則連接屏東縣與台東縣。

column1: Ferry service is operated between Donggang Township and Baisha Port and Dafu Port on the offshore Lamay Island.
column2: 在東港鎮到白沙尾、小琉球大福漁港之間有渡輪服務。

column1: Hoklo immigrants to the area during the 16th and 17th centuries called the region Takau (Chinese: 打狗; Pe̍h-ōe-jī: Tá-káu).
column2: 於 16、17 世紀移居的福佬移民，將此地稱為打狗。

column1: The surface meaning of the associated Chinese characters was "beat the dog".
column2: 打狗一名的中文字意解釋為毆打犬隻。

column1: According to one theory, the name Takau originates from the aboriginal Siraya language and translates as "bamboo forest".
column2: 一種說法指出，打狗之名源自西拉雅原住民語中的「竹林」。

column1: According to another theory, the name evolved via metathesis from the name of the Makatao tribe, who inhabited the area at the time of European and Hoklo settlement.
column2: 另一種說法指出，該地名本是馬卡道部落的名字，在歐洲與福佬移民當時居住在此處。

column1: The Makatao are considered to be part of the Siraya tribe.
column2: 馬卡道是西拉雅部落的一部分。

column1: During the Dutch colonization of southern Taiwan, the area was known as Tancoia to the western world for a period of about three decades.
column2: 在荷蘭占據南台灣時間，約有三十年時間，西方人將該地稱為 Tancoia。

column1: In 1662, the Dutch were expelled by the Kingdom of Tungning, founded by Ming loyalists of Koxinga.
column2: 1662 年，荷蘭人遭由明朝遺臣鄭成功的東寧王國驅逐出去。

column1: His son, Zheng Jing, renamed the village Banlian-chiu (Chinese: 萬年州; Pe̍h-ōe-jī: Bān-liân-chiu; literally: 'ten-thousand-year region (zhou)') in 1664.
column2: 其子鄭經於 1664 年將該村莊更名為萬年州。

column1: The name of "Takau" was restored in the late 1670s, when the town expanded drastically with immigrants from mainland China, and was kept through Taiwan's cession to the Japanese Empire in 1895.
column2: 打狗之名於 1670 年代左右恢復，當時因中國大陸移民，城區大為擴張，其名一直沿用到 1895 年台灣割讓給日本帝國為止。

column1: In his 1903 general history of Taiwan, US Consul to Formosa James W. Davidson relates that "Takow" was already a well-known name in English.
column2: 美國駐台領事達飛聲與其 1903 年出版的台灣通史中指出，Takow 在英文中已是個眾人皆知的名詞。

column1: In 1920, the name was changed to Takao (Japanese: 高雄, after Takao (Kyoto)) and administered the area under Takao Prefecture.
column2: 1920 年，該地更名為 Takao（襲自日本京都的高雄），由高雄州管轄。

column1: While the new name had quite a different surface meaning, its pronunciation in Japanese sounded more or less the same as the old name spoken in Hokkien.
column2: 雖然新地名的字面意義完全不同，但其日語發音和舊名的台語發音幾乎相同。

column1: After Taiwan was handed to the Republic of China, the name did not change, but the official romanization became "Kaohsiung" (pinyin: Gāoxióng) after the Standard Chinese pronunciation of 高雄.
column2: 自中華民國接收台灣後，並未變更地名，但其羅馬拼音改為反應其國語讀音的「Kaohsiung」。

column1: The name Takau remains the official name of the city in Austronesian languages of Taiwan such as Rukai, although these are not widely spoken in the city.
column2: 打狗之名仍用於該市的南島語族官方地名之中，例如魯凱語，不過魯凱語在該市並不常用。

column1: The name also remains popular locally in the naming of businesses, associations, and events.
column2: 當地的商業、組織和活動中，還經常使用打狗之名。

column1: The written history of Kaohsiung can be traced back to the early 17th century, through archaeological studies have found signs of human activity in the region from as long as 7,000 years ago.
column2: 高雄的歷史記載最早見於 17 世紀初，不過考古研究發現七千年前該地就有人類活動的跡象。

column1: Prior to the 17th century, the region was inhabited by the Makatao people of the Siraya tribe, who settled on what they named Takau Isle (translated to 打狗嶼 by Ming Chinese explorers); "Takau" meaning "bamboo forest" in the aboriginal language.
column2: 17 世紀之前，定居該地的主要是西拉雅族的馬卡道群，住在明代探險家稱為打狗嶼的地方；打狗在原住民語中為竹林之意。

column1: The earliest evidence of human activity in the Kaohsiung area dates back to roughly 4,700–5,200 years ago.
column2: 高雄最早的人類活動記錄，可追溯至約  4,700 - 5,200 年前。

column1: Most of the discovered remnants were located in the hills surrounding Kaohsiung Harbor.
column2: 多數發掘出的遺物，分布在高雄港周邊的山區。

column1: Artifacts were found at Shoushan, Longquan Temple, Taoziyuan, Zuoying, Houjing, Fudingjin and Fengbitou.
column2: 在壽山、龍泉寺、桃仔園、左營、後勁、覆鼎金、鳳鼻頭發現考古文物。

column1: The prehistoric Dapenkeng, Niuchouzi, Dahu, and Niaosong civilizations were known to inhabit the region.
column2: 該區的史前文化遺址包括大坌坑、牛稠子、大湖、蔦松。

column1: Studies of the prehistoric ruins at Longquan Temple have shown that that civilization occurred at roughly the same times as the beginnings of the aboriginal Makatao civilization, suggesting a possible origin for the latter.
column2: 在龍泉寺的考古遺址研究指出，該地文化約與馬卡道原住民文化同一時間，因此可能源自馬卡道人。

column1: Unlike some other archaeological sites in the area, the Longquan Temple ruins are relatively well preserved.
column2: 和該區域某些考古遺址不同的是，龍泉寺遺址保存相當完整。

column1: Prehistoric artifacts discovered have suggested that the ancient Kaohsiung Harbor was originally a lagoon, with early civilizations functioning primarily as hunter-gatherer societies.
column2: 發現的史前文物指出，高雄港在古代可能是個潟湖，原始居民可能主要是採獵社會。

column1: Some agricultural tools have also been discovered, suggesting that some agricultural activity was also present.
column2: 同時也發現部分農具，因此可能也有某些農業活動。

column1: The first Chinese records of the region were written in 1603 by Chen Di, a member of Ming admiral Shen You-rong's expedition to rid the waters around Taiwan and Penghu of pirates.
column2: 該區最早的中文文獻記載，是由陳第於 1603 年撰寫；他隨著明代將領沈有容的軍隊，驅離台灣澎湖沿海一帶的海盜。

column1: In his report on the "Eastern Barbarian Lands" (Dong Fan Ji), Chen Di referred to a Ta-kau Isle:
column2: 在他的「東蕃記」中，陳第稱此處為打狗嶼。

column1: It is unknown when the barbarians (Taiwanese aborigines) arose on this island in the ocean beyond Penghu, but they are present at Keeong Harbor (nowaday's Budai, Chiayi), the bay of Galaw (Anping, Tainan), Laydwawan (Tainan City), Yaw Harbor (Cheting, Kaohsiung), Takau Isle (Kaohsiung City), Little Tamsui (Donggang, Pingtung), Siangkeykaw (Puzi, Chiayi), Gali forest (Jiali District, Tainan), the village of Sabah (Tamsui, Taipei), and Dwabangkang (Bali, New Taipei City).
column2: 目前尚不清楚這些台灣原住民是在何時登上澎湖海域的島嶼，但他們的足跡曾出現在今之嘉義布袋、台南安平、台南市、高雄茄萣、高雄市、台南加里、台北淡水、新北市八里等地。

column1: Taiwan became a Dutch colony in 1624, after the Dutch East India Company was ejected from Penghu by Ming forces.
column2: 台灣於 1624 年成為荷蘭殖民地，但之後荷屬東印度公司在澎湖遭到明軍逐出。

column1: At the time, Takau was already one of the most important fishing ports in southern Taiwan.
column2: 當時打狗已是南台灣的重要漁港。

column1: The Dutch named the place Tankoya, and the harbor Tancoia.
column2: 荷蘭人稱之為 Tankoya 或 Tancoia 港。

column1: The Dutch missionary François Valentijn named Takau Mountain "Ape Berg", a name that would find its way onto European navigational charts well into the 18th century.
column2: 荷蘭傳教士瓦倫丁將打狗山命名為「猴山」，且出現在 18 世紀的歐洲海圖之上。

column1: Tankoia was located north of Ape's Hill and a few hours south from Tayouan (modern-day Anping, Tainan) by sail.
column2: Takonia 位於猴山北邊，距大員（今台南安平）僅數小時航程。

column1: At the time, a wide shallow bay existed there, sufficient for small vessels.
column2: 當時有個又寬又淺的海灣，足以讓小型船隻進入。

column1: However, constant silting changed the coastline.
column2: 但是，長期淤積改變了海岸線。

column1: During this time, Taiwan was divided into five administrative districts, with Takau belonging to the southernmost district.
column2: 當時台灣畫分為五個行政區，打狗位於最南邊。

column1: In 1630, the first large scale immigration of Han Chinese to Taiwan began due to famine in Fujian, with merchants and traders from China seeking to purchase hunting licenses from the Dutch or hide out in aboriginal villages to escape authorities in China.
column2: 1630 年福建發生饑荒，導致第一波漢人大批移民來台，來自中國的商人與貿易商，來此尋求購買荷蘭人核發的狩獵取可，或是藏身於原住民村落中，以躲避中國政府追捕。

column1: In 1684, the Qing dynasty annexed Taiwan and renamed the town Fengshan County (Chinese: 鳳山縣; pinyin: Fèngshān Xiàn), considering it a part of Taiwan Prefecture.
column2: 1684 年，清國將台灣收入版圖，將該地更名為鳳山縣，由台灣府管轄。

column1: It was first opened as a port during the 1680s and subsequently prospered fairly for generations.
column2: 在 1680 年代，該地開港，接著帶來好幾世代的繁華。

column1: In 1895, Taiwan was ceded to Japan as part of the Treaty of Shimonoseki.
column2: 1895 年，台灣依馬關條約，割讓予日本。

column1: Administrative control of the city was moved from New Fongshan Castle to the Fongshan Sub-District of Tainan Chō (臺南廳).
column2: 該市的行政管理中心，自新鳳山城移至台南廳鳳山支廳。

column1: In November 1901, twenty chō were established in total; Hōzan Chō (鳳山廳) was established nearby.
column2: 1901 年共新設 20 個廳，鳳山廳也在當時成立。

column1: In 1909, Hōzan Chō was abolished, and Takow was merged into Tainan Chō.
column2: 1909 年裁撤鳳山廳，打狗畫歸台南廳。

column1: In 1920, during the tenure of 8th Governor-General Den Kenjirō, districts were abolished in favor of prefectures.
column2: 1920 年，在台灣第 8 任總督田健治郎任內改廳為州。

column1: Thus the city was administered as Takao City (高雄市 Takao-shi) under Takao Prefecture.
column2: 該市改制為高雄市，由高雄州管轄。

column1: The Japanese developed Takao, especially the harbor that became the foundation of Kaohsiung to be a port city.
column2: 高雄在日本統治期間快速發展，特別是港區成為高雄日後成為港市的基礎。

column1: Takao was then systematically modernized and connected to the end of North-South Railway.
column2: 高雄自此展開系統性的現代化過程，成為縱貫鐵路的終點站。

column1: Kaohsiung Harbor was also developed starting from 1894. The city center was relocated several times during the period due to the government's development strategy.
column2: 高雄港自 1894 年開始發展。由於政府的發展策略，當時的市中心曾多次轉移。

column1: Development was initially centered on Ki-au (Chinese: 旗後; Pe̍h-ōe-jī: Kî-āu) region but the government began laying railways, upgrading the harbor, and passing new urban plans.
column2: 該區發展始於旗後地區，但政府開始敷設鐵道、擴建港區，並通過新都市計畫。

column1: New industries such as refinery, machinery, shipbuilding and cementing were also introduced.
column2: 同時導入煉油、機械、造船、水泥等新式工業。

column1: Before and during World War II it handled a growing share of Taiwan's agricultural exports to Japan, and was also a major base for Japan's campaigns in Southeast Asia and the Pacific.
column2: 在二次大戰之前與戰爭期間，自高雄出口至日本的農產品不斷增加，該市也成為日本在東南亞與太平洋活動的主要基地。

column1: Extremely ambitious plans for the construction of a massive modern port were drawn up.
column2: 也制定了非常積極的現代化港口建設計畫。

column1: Toward the end of the war, the Japanese promoted some industrial development at Kaohsiung, establishing an aluminum industry based on the abundant hydroelectric power produced by the Sun Moon Lake project in the mountains.
column2: 戰爭末期，日本在高雄推動某些工業發展，利用日月潭豐沛的水力發電資源，設立煉鋁工廠。

column1: The city was heavily bombed by Task Force 38 and FEAF during World War II between 1944-1945.
column2: 該市於 1944－1945 年間遭到第 38 特遣部隊與美軍遠東航空隊的重轟炸。

column1: After control of Taiwan was handed over from Japan to the government of the Republic of China on 25 October 1945, Kaohsiung City and Kaohsiung County were established as a provincial city and a county of Taiwan Province respectively on 25 December 1945.
column2: 1945 年 10 月 25 日，日本將台灣控制權移交中華民國政府，高雄市與高雄州於 1945 年 12 月 25 日改為省轄市與縣。

column1: The official romanization of the name came to be "Kaohsiung", based on the Wade–Giles romanization of the Mandarin reading of the kanji name.
column2: 官方羅馬拼音改為「Kaohsiung」，源於「高雄」漢字國語讀音的威妥瑪式拼音。

column1: Kaohsiung City then consisted of 10 districts, which were Gushan, Lianya (renamed "Lingya" in 1952), Nanzi, Cianjin, Cianzhen, Cijin, Sanmin, Sinsing, Yancheng, and Zuoying.
column2: 高雄市下轄十個區：鼓山、連雅（1952年改為苓雅）、楠梓、前金、前鎮、旗津、三民、新興、鹽埕、左營。

column1: During this time, Kaohsiung developed rapidly.
column2: 這段期間，高雄飛速發展。

column1: The port, badly damaged in World War II, was restored.
column2: 在二次大戰期間損毀的港區也已修復。

column1: It also became a fishing port for boats sailing to Philippine and Indonesian waters.
column2: 成為航向菲律濱與印尼水域漁船的漁港。

column1: Largely because of its climate, Kaohsiung overtook Keelung as Taiwan's major port.
column2: 由於氣候因素，高雄取代基隆，成為台灣主要港口。

column1: Kaohsiung also surpassed Tainan to become the second largest city of Taiwan in the late 1970s and Kaohsiung City was upgraded from a provincial city to special municipality on 1 July 1979, by the Executive Yuan with a total of 11 districts.
column2: 在 1970 年後半，高雄也超越台南，成為台灣第二大城市，高雄市也於 1979 年 7 月 1 日自省轄市升格院轄市，下轄 11 區。

column1: The additional district is Siaogang District, which was annexed from Siaogang Township of Kaohsiung County.
column2: 新畫入的是小港區，自高雄縣小港鎮畫入。

column1: The Kaohsiung Incident, where the government suppressed a commemoration of International Human Rights Day, occurred on December 10, 1979.
column2: 1979 年 12 月 10 日發生的高雄事件，導因於政府鎮壓國際人權日的紀念活動。

column1: Since then, Kaohsiung gradually grew into a political center of the Pan-Green population of Taiwan, in opposition to Taipei where the majority population is Kuomintang supporters.
column2: 自此，高雄逐漸成為台灣泛綠陣營的重鎮，對抗以國民黨支持者居多的台北。

column1: On December 25, 2010, Kaohsiung City merged with Kaohsiung County to form a larger special municipality with Lingya District and Fengshan District becoming the capital city, ending the administration of Kaohsiung County.
column2: 2010 年 12 月 25 日，高雄市連同合併高雄縣成為六都之一，苓雅區與鳳山區成為行政中心，高雄縣自此終結。

column1: On 31 July 2014, a series of gas explosions occurred in the Cianzhen and Lingya Districts of the city, killing 31 and injuring more than 300.
column2: 2014 年 7 月 31 日，前鎮區與苓雅區發生嚴重瓦斯氣爆，導致 31 死、300 人以上受傷。

column1: Five roads were destroyed in an area of nearly 20 square kilometres (7.7 square miles) near the city center.
column2: 市中心附近約 20 平方公里（7.7 平方英哩）的區域，有 5 條幹道被毀。

column1: It was the largest gas explosion in Taiwan's modern history.
column2: 這也是台灣現代史上最嚴重的瓦斯爆炸事件。

column1: The city sits on the southwestern coast of Taiwan facing the Taiwan Strait, bordering Tainan City to the north, Chiayi and Nantou County to the northwest, Taitung County to its northeast and Pingtung County to the south and southeast.
column2: 該市位於台灣西南岸，面對台灣海峽，北鄰台南市、西北接嘉義縣與南投縣，東北接台東縣，南面與東南面為屏東縣。

column1: The downtown areas are centered on Kaohsiung Harbor with Cijin Island on the other side of the harbor acting as a natural breakwater.
column2: 市區圍繞高雄港中心，另一方向的旗津島，如同高雄港的天然防波堤。

column1: The Love River (Ai River) flows into the harbor through the Old City and downtown.
column2: 愛河流經舊市區與新市區，注入港內。

column1: Zuoying Military Harbor lies to the north of Kaohsiung Harbor and the city center.
column2: 左營軍港在高雄港與市中心北側。

column1: Kaohsiung's natural landmarks include Ape Hill and Mount Banping.
column2: 高雄的天然地標，包括壽山與半屏山。

column1: As in most Taiwanese cities or counties, the majority of the population are Han Taiwanese.
column2: 和其他台灣主要城市與縣份一樣，該市主要人口為漢人。

column1: The Hans are then divided into 3 subgroups, Hoklo, Hakka, and Waishengren.
column2: 漢人又分為三類：福佬、客家、外省人。

column1: The Hoklo and Waishengren mostly live in flatland townships and the city centre, while the majority of the Hakka population live in the suburbs or rural townships of the northeastern hills.
column2: 福佬與外省人多半住在市中心平地區，大部分客家族群則住在郊區，或東北側山區的鄉下村庄。

column1: The Taiwanese aborigines of Kaohsiung, who belong to various ethnic groups that speak different languages belonging to the Austronesian language family similar/related to those of Maritime Southeast Asia and Oceania, mostly live in the mountain townships such as Taoyuan or Namasia.
column2: 高雄的台灣原住民分屬多個族群，使用南島語系之下的多種不同語言，與東南亞海洋與大洋洲民族語言近似或相關，多數住在如桃源或那瑪夏等山區。

column1: The main aboriginal groups living within the city center include the Bunun, Rukai, Tsou and the Kanakanavus.
column2: 住在該市內的原住民族，包括布農、魯凱、鄒族、卡那卡那富族。

column1: As of December 2010, Kaohsiung city hosts around 21,000 foreign spouses.
column2: 截至 2010 年 12 月，高雄市有 21,000 名外籍配偶。

column1: Around 12,353 are Mainland Chinese, 4,244 are Vietnamese, around 800 Japanese and Indonesians and around 4,000 other Asians or foreigners from Europe or the Americas.
column2: 其中 12,353 人來自中國大陸、4,244 人來自越南、約 800 人來自日本與印尼，還有約 4,000 人來自其他亞洲國家或歐美等國。

column1: As of April 2013, Kaohsiung hosts 35,074 foreign workers who mainly work as factory workers or foreign maids (not including foreign specialists such as teachers and other professionals).
column2: 截至 2013 年 4 月，高雄共有 35,074 名外籍勞工，多數在工廠工作或擔任女傭（不包括外籍專門技術人員，如老師或專家）。

column1: Within around half of which are Indonesians, and the other half being workers from other Southeast Asian countries mainly from Vietnam, the Philippines or Thailand.
column2: 其中約有一半為印尼人，另外一半則主要來自越南、菲律賓、泰國等東南亞國家。

column1: Kaohsiung is a major international port and industrial city in the southwest of Taiwan.
column2: 高雄是台灣西南方主要國際港口暨工業城。

column1: As an exporting center, Kaohsiung serves the agricultural interior of southern Taiwan, as well as the mountains of the southeast.
column2: 高雄是南台灣農產品與東南方山產的出口中心。

column1: Major raw material exports include rice, sugar, bananas, pineapples, peanuts (groundnuts) and citrus fruits.
column2: 主要原料主口包括米、糖、香蕉、鳳梨、花生、柑橘等。

column1: The 2,200-hectare (5,400-acre) Linhai Industrial Park, on the waterfront, was completed in the mid-1970s and includes a steel mill, shipyard, petrochemical complex, and other industries.
column2: 占地 2,200 公頃（5,400 畝）的臨海工業區位在岸邊，於 1970 年代中期完工，包括煉鋼廠、造船廠、石化工業與其他工業。

column1: The city has an oil refinery, aluminum and cement works, fertilizer factories, sugar refineries, brick and tile works, canning factories, salt-manufacturing factories, and papermaking plants.
column2: 該市擁有一座煉油廠、煉鋁及水泥工廠、肥料廠、糖廠、紅磚與瓷磚廠、製罐廠、製鹽廠與造紙廠。

column1: Designated an export-processing zone in the late 1970s, Kaohsiung also attracted foreign investment to process locally purchased raw materials for export.
column2: 1970 年代設為加工出口區，高雄吸引許多外國投資，在當地採購原料，加工後出口外銷。

column1: The ongoing Nansing Project is a plan to reclaim 250 hectares (620 acres) of land along the coast by 2011.
column2: 執行中的南星計畫，將在 2011 年前將 250 公頃（620 畝）岸邊土地畫為保留區。

column1: The Kaohsiung Harbor Bureau plans to buy 49 hectares of the reclaimed land to establish a solar energy industrial district that would be in the harbor's free trade zone.
column2: 高雄港務局計畫購買保留的 49 公頃土地，建立太陽能產業專區，且將成為該港的自由貿易區。

column1: The gross domestic product (GDP) in nominal terms of Kaohsiung City is estimated to be around US$45 billion, and US$90 billion for the metropolitan region.
column2: 高雄市的名目總生產毛額，估計達 450 億美元，都會區則為 900 億美元。

column1: As of 2008, the GDP per capita in nominal terms was approximately US$24,000.
column2: 2008 年時，人均名目生產毛額約為 24,000 美元。

column1: Despite early success and heavy governmental investment, the city suffers from the economic north–south divide in Taiwan, which continues to be the centre of political debate.
column2: 雖然高雄很早就發展，也獲政府大量投資，但該市仍面臨台灣嚴重的重北輕南問題，也為政治爭論的重心。

column1: There has been public aims to shift the local economy towards tourism and cultural industries, with projects such as Pier-2 Art Center, National Kaohsiung Center for the Arts and Kaohsiung Music Center.
column2: 民意主張地方經濟應朝向觀光與文化產業發展，例如駁二藝術特區計畫、國立高雄美術館與高雄音樂中心等。

column1: The main agricultural produce in Kaohsiung are vegetables, fruits and rice with a total arable land of 473 km², which accounts to 16% of the total area of the municipality.
column2: 高雄主要的農產品為蔬菜、水果與稻米，總耕作面積達 473 平方公里，占全市面積的 16%。

column1: Kaohsiung has the highest production of guava, jujube and lychee in Taiwan.
column2: 高雄是全台灣芭樂、棗子與荔枝產量最高的地區。

column1: The main animal husbandry are chicken, dairy cattle, deer, duck, goose, pigs and sheep.
column2: 主要禽畜產品為雞、乳牛、鹿、鴨、鵝、豬與羊。

column1: The total annual agricultural outcome in Kaohsiung is NT$24.15 billion.
column2: 高雄的總農業產值達新台幣 240.15 億元。

column1: Main landmarks of Kaohsiung city include the 85 Sky Tower, the ferris wheel of the Kaohsiung Dream Mall, the Kaohsiung Arena and Kaohsiung Harbor.
column2: 高雄主要地標為八五大樓、高雄夢時代摩天輪、高雄巨蛋與高雄港。

column1: The Beijing railway station's predecessor was the Zhengyangmen railway station, also called the Beijing station, which was located 2.5 km (1.6 mi) due west, just outside Zhengyangmen (also known as Qianmen), a gate in the city wall directly south of Tiananmen Square.
column2: 北京火車站的前身是正陽門火車站，也叫北京站，約在正陽門外西邊 2.5 公里 (1.6 英哩) 處，正陽門就在天安門廣場正南方，是北京市的一個城門。

column1: The Zhengyangmen railway station was built in 1901 and served as the terminus of the Kaiping Tramway and Imperial Railways of North China, also known as the Beijing–Shanhaiguan Railway until 1959 when the station closed after the opening of the current Beijing railway station and has become part of the China Railway Museum.
column2: 正陽門車站建於 1901 年，是唐胥鐵路 (又稱北京－山海關鐵路) 的終點站，1959 年當現在的北京車站開始營運後，本站關閉，並成為中國鐵道博物館的一部分。

column1: To commemorate the Tenth Anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China in 1958 began the planning and construction of ten large-scale projects, known as the "Ten Great Buildings" to showcase the new outlook of the country and the Beijing railway station was amongst the projects undertaken.
column2: 為慶祝中華人民共和國開國十周年，中共中央委員會於 1958 年開始十項大型建設計畫，亦稱「十大建築」，以展示國家新氣象，而北京車站就是計畫中的其中一項。

column1: In late October 1958, according to the early 1950 Beijing municipal government's construction and planning records, the design arrangements for the new railway station was commenced.
column2: 根據1950 年初北京市政府建設與計畫的記錄，1958 年 10 月底發表了新火車站的設計協議。

column1: The station's design was assigned to the Ministry of Railway Institute's third department (now the Third Railway Survey and Design Institute Group Co.
column2: 該站的設計交由鐵道部第三局 (今之中國鐵路經濟規畫研究院有限公司) 進行。

column1: Ltd) with the station house building chaired by then renowned architects Yang Tingbao (杨廷宝) and Chen Deng'ao (陈登鏊), the National Building and Industry Department and the Nanjing Institute of Architectural Design were to cooperate in the design tasks.
column2: 站體建築由當時新上任的建築師楊廷寶與陳登鏊設計，國家建設與工業部與南京建築學院參與設計工作。

column1: The station's design progressed rapidly and by early December the same year, the whole design proposal was completed.
column2: 車站設計進度快速，在同年 12 月初，整體設計案已完成。

column1: On December 10, the design proposal was approved by the Central Committee.
column2: 12 月 10，中央委會會批准該設計案。

column1: The then Premier Zhou Enlai was also very concerned about the design and construction of the new Beijing railway station, and dealt with aspects concerning the direction and positioning of station names to the layout of the VIP room environment.
column2: 時任總理周恩來十分關切北京新站的設計與建設，從車站名稱的比例和排列，以及貴賓室環境的布局，都親自指示。

column1: In determining the design program proposal, Zhou Enlai proposed that turrets be built on each of the two wings of the main building and this suggestion was adopted.
column2: 在決定最後設計方案，周恩來建議在主建物兩翼興建塔樓，該建議獲得採納。

column1: On January 20, 1959 the construction of the new station commenced with the number of construction workers reaching up to two million people during the peak stage and project investment amounted to 57.82 million yuan.
column2: 1959 年 1 月 20 日，主建物正式開始興建，在工程高峰，參與工人多達 200 萬名，計畫預算達 5782 萬人民幣。

column1: Soviet experts were also hired to give technical guidance at the construction sites.
column2: 同時聘請蘇聯專家，在建築工地提供技術指導。

column1: In just over seven months, the project was completed on September 10, 1959.
column2: 該計畫於 1959 年 9 月 10 日完成，只用了七個月。

column1: The new Beijing railway station covered an area of two hundred and fifty thousand square meters, the Station House Building site covered an area of 46,700 square meters, the station plaza comprised an area of forty thousand square meters.
column2: 新北京車站佔地 25 萬平方公尺，站體建築站地 46,700 平方公司，站前廣場則有 4 萬平方公尺。

column1: Chairman Mao Zedong wrote the calligraphic characters in the station sign.
column2: 毛澤東主席為車站標誌揮毫書寫。

column1: The Beijing railway station was one of the largest construction projects in mainland China during that time with modern facilities and it was also China's first large modern railway terminal.
column2: 北京車站是中國大陸當時最大現代化建築，也是中國第一個大型現代化火車站。

column1: At the time of completion, the station has a twelve tracks and six railway platforms with canopies attached to them.
column2: 完成當時，該站擁有 12 條股道、6 個附有屋頂的月台。

column1: The Station house building faced south and the architecture included both a Chinese traditional style and the Soviet Stalinist architecture。The twelve passenger waiting rooms comprised a total area of fourteen thousand square meters and was able to accommodate 14,000 waiting passengers.
column2: 站體面向南方，建物同時包括傳統中國風格與蘇聯史達林造型。12 個候車室總共占地 14,000 平方公尼，可容納 14,000 位候車乘客。

column1: The inner complex of the Main Station Building contained a passenger waiting room, mother and child waiting room, movie theater, recreation hall, visitors' restaurants, post office, clinic and other facilities.
column2: 車站主體內部包括候車室、親子候車室、電影院、休憩大廳、訪客餐廳、郵局、醫務室等設施。

column1: Installed on the roof of the Station House were two marble clock faces and every morning from 7am to 9pm the bell sounded punctually and "The East Is Red song is played out.
column2: 在站體屋頂安裝兩具大理石時鐘，每天清晨七到九點整點時播放「東方紅」歌曲。

column1: The Beijing station equipment was considered to be relatively advanced at its -time with four AC2-59 type escalators installed in the interior; the joint design and production of the escalators were coordinated by the Shanghai Jiao Tong University and Shanghai Elevator Company. The four sets of escalators were replaced during the 1980 and again during 1990; the most recent replacement of the elevators occurred in early2005 - the design being a product of Otis Company.
column2: 北京站的設備相當先進，在內部安裝四架 AC2-59 電梯，電梯的設計與製造由上海交通大學與上海電梯公司合作進行。四組電扶梯分別於 1980 和 1990 年兩度更新，而電梯最近一次更新於 2005 初，採用奧蒂斯公司的產品。

column1: In pre-Han times (i.e., before 206 BC), the site of the city of Shiyi in the state of Zhao was located in this area, and from Han (206 BC–AD 220) to Sui (581–618) times it was the site of a county seat with the same name.
column2: 在漢代前（即公元前206年之前），趙國石邑市的遺址位於這個地區，從漢（公元前206年-公元220年）到隋（581-618年）時代，它是同名縣城的所在地。

column1: With the reorganization of local government in the early period of the Tang dynasty (618–907), the county was abolished.
column2: 隨著唐朝初年（618-907年）地方政府的重組，該縣遭到裁撤。

column1: The name "Shijiazhuang" was first mentioned in 1535 on a stele of a local temple.
column2: 「石家莊」這個名字，於1535年在當地一座寺廟的石碑上首次出現。

column1: Shijiazhuang was then little more than a local market town, subordinated to the flourishing city of Zhengding a few miles to the north.
column2: 當時，石家莊只不過是一個當地的市集小鎮，隸屬於北部幾英里處繁榮的正定市。

column1: The growth of Shijiazhuang into one of China's major cities began in 1905, when the Beijing–Wuhan (Hankou) railway reached the area, stimulating trade and encouraging local farmers to grow cash crops.
column2: 石家莊發展成為中國主要城市之一，始於1905年，當時京漢（漢口）鐵路到達該地區，刺激了貿易，鼓勵當地農民種植經濟作物。

column1: Two years later the town became the junction for the new Shitai line, running from Shijiazhuang to Taiyuan, Shanxi.
column2: 兩年後，該鎮成為從石家莊到山西太原的新石太線的交會處。

column1: The connection transformed the town from a local collecting centre and market into a communications centre of national importance on the main route from Beijing and Tianjin to Shanxi, and later, when the railway from Taiyuan was extended to the southwest, to Shaanxi as well.
column2: 鐵路線將該鎮從當地的集散中心和市場，轉變為從北京和天津到山西的主要路線，以及具備國家級重要性的通訊中心；後來，太原的鐵路也延伸到西南方向，也延伸到陝西。

column1: The city also became the centre of an extensive road network.
column2: 這座城市也成為發達的公路網中心。

column1: Pre-World War II Shijiazhuang was a large railway town as well as a commercial and collecting centre for Shanxi and regions farther west and for agricultural produce of the North China Plain, particularly grain, tobacco, and cotton.
column2: 二戰前，石家莊是一個大型鐵路城鎮，也是山西和更西部地區以及華北平原農產品，特別是穀物、菸草和棉花的商業和集散地。

column1: By 1935 it had far outstripped Zhengding as an economic centre.
column2: 1935年後，該市遠遠超越了正定，成為經濟中心。

column1: At the end of World War II the character of the city changed when it took on an administrative role as the preeminent city in western Hebei, and developed into an industrial city.
column2: 第二次世界大戰結束後，該市開始成為河北西部的重要行政城市，之後這座城市的特色開始改變，發展成為一個工業城。

column1: Some industries, such as match manufacturing, tobacco processing, and glassmaking, had already been established before the war.
column2: 戰前已經有一些行業在此興盛，如火柴製造、菸草加工和玻璃製造。

column1: On November 12, 1947, the city was captured by Communist forces.
column2: 1947年11月12日，該市被共黨軍隊佔領。

column1: In 1948 the city, formerly known as Shímén (石門), was renamed Shijiazhuang.
column2: 1948年，這座過去稱為石門的城市，更名為石家莊。

column1: Xibaipo, a village about 90 km (56 mi) from downtown Shijiazhuang, in Pingshan County was the location of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the headquarters of the People's Liberation Army during the decisive stages of the Chinese Civil War between May 26, 1948 and March 23, 1949, at which point they were moved to Beijing.
column2: 西柏坡是一個距離石家莊市中心約90公里（56英里）的村莊，位於平山縣，在1948年5月26日至1949年3月23日中國內戰的決定性階段，是中國共產黨中央委員會所在地和人民解放軍總部，之後轉移到北京。

column1: Today, the area is a memorial site.
column2: 現今該處成為紀念園區。

column1: After 1949 the industrialisation of the city gathered momentum.
column2: 1949年後，該市加速工業化發展。

column1: Its population more than tripled in the decade 1948–58.
column2: 在1948－58年間，該市人口成長超過三倍。

column1: In the 1950s, the city experienced a major expansion in the textile industry, with large-scale cotton spinning, weaving, printing, and dyeing works.
column2: 1950 年代，該市的紡織業快速發展，包括大型棉紡、梭織、印染工業等。

column1: In addition there are plants processing local farm produce.
column2: 除此之外，也有當地農產品的處理廠。

column1: In the 1960s it was the site of a new chemical industry, with plants producing fertilizer and caustic soda.
column2: 1960 年代，化工廠在該處興起，製造肥料與苛性鈉。

column1: Shijiazhuang also became an engineering base, with a tractor-accessory plant.
column2: 石家莊開始變成工業中心，新增了曳引機零件廠。

column1: There are important coal deposits at Jingxing and Huailu, now named Luquan, a few miles to the west in the foothills of the Taihang Mountains, which provide fuel for a thermal-generating plant supplying power to local industries.
column2: 在太行山麓數英哩處有重要煤礦產區井陘與獲鹿，現稱鹿泉，提供當地一間火力發電廠燃料，以供應當地工業所需的電力。

column1: In 1967, Tianjin was again carved out of Hebei, remaining a separate entity today, and thus the provincial capital was moved to Baoding.
column2: 1967 年，天津再次畫出河北轄區外，至今仍維持獨立行政體，因此省會遷至保定。

column1: It was chaotic in the midst of the Cultural Revolution, and under the direction of Mao Zedong, in 1968, to "prepare for war and natural disasters", Shijiazhuang became the provincial capital.
column2: 文革期間動亂不斷，在毛澤東的主導下，1968 年了「準備對抗自然災害的戰鬥」，石家莊成為省會。

column1: In 2014, the GDP of Shijiazhuang reached CNY(RMB) ￥510.02 billion (about $80.45 billion in USD), an increase of 12 percent over the previous year.
column2: 2014 年石家莊的 GDP 達到 5100.2 億人民幣（約 804.5  億美元），年長達 12%。

column1: Shijiazhuang has become a major industrial city in North China and is considered to be the economic center of Hebei province.
column2: 石家莊成為華北主要工業城，也是河北省的經濟中心。

column1: The city is a major base for the pharmaceutical and textile industries.
column2: 該市是製藥和紡織業的主要基地。

column1: Other sectors include machinery and chemicals, building materials, light industry and electronics.
column2: 其他產業包括機械、化工、建材、輕工業與電子工業。

column1: With abundant agricultural resources, Shijiazhuang has 590,000 hectares of cultivated land and is the main source of cotton, pears, dates and walnuts in Hebei province.
column2: 石家莊的農產資源豐富，有 590,000 畝耕地，是河北省主要的棉花、梨、棗、胡桃產地。

column1: In 2008, total imports reached US$1.393 billion, an increase of 42.1 percent over the previous year.
column2: 2008 年，總進口量達 13.93 億美元，年增率達 42.1%。

column1: Exports increased by 34.9 percent to US$5.596 billion.
column2: 出口增加了 34.9%，達 55.96 億美元。

column1: 2006 World Bank reported that Shijiazhuang was spending less than RMB400 per capita on education, as opposed to Beijing (RMB1,044) and Weihai (RMB1,631).
column2: 世界銀行於 2006 年的報告指出，石家莊在的人均教育支出僅 400 人民幣，少於北京（1,044 人民幣）與威海（1,631 人民幣）。

column1: The city is a centre for the dairy trade, being the headquarters of the Sanlu Group.
column2: 該市是乳品交易中心，三鹿集團總部設於該市。

column1: Sanlu became Shijiazhuang's largest taxpayer since it had become the largest formula seller in China for a continuous 15-year period.
column2: 三鹿在連續 15 年成為中國最大配方乳廠商後，變成石家莊納稅額最高者。

column1: Richard McGregor, author of The Party: The Secret World of China's Communist Rulers, said that Sanlu became "an invaluable asset for a city otherwise struggling to attract industry and investment on a par with China's premier metropolises."
column2: 《黨：中國共產主義統治者的祕密世界》一書的作者理查・麥奎格表示，三鹿「對於一個難以吸引工業和投資的城市來說，是個寶貴資產，不然無法與其他中國一級城市平起平坐。」

column1: Both the dairy trade and Sanlu were affected by the 2008 Chinese milk scandal.
column2: 在 2008 年中國發生乳製品醜聞後，乳品交易與三鹿都大受影響。

column1: The chairman and general manager of Sanlu, and several party officials, including the vice-mayor in charge of food and agriculture, Zhang Fawang, were reportedly removed from office.
column2: 三鹿董事長、總經理，以及多位黨政高官，如負責食品與農產的副市長張發旺遭到撤職。

column1: Mayor Ji Chuntang reportedly resigned on 17 September.
column2: 市長冀純堂於 9 月 17 日辭職。

column1: Shijiazhuang is a transportation hub at the intersection point of the Beijing–Guangzhou, Taiyuan–Dezhou, and Shuozhou–Huanghua railroads.
column2: 石家莊是京廣、太原-德州和朔州-黃華等鐵路交會的交通樞紐。

column1: The new Shijiazhuang Railway Station (opened December 2012) has a rare distinction of being served by both the "conventional"
column2: 於 2012 年 12 月開始營運的石家莊新站，是少數同時具備「傳統」

column1: Beijing–Guangzhou Railway and the new Beijing–Guangzhou–Shenzhen–Hong Kong High-Speed Railway.
column2: 京廣鐵路與新建北京－廣州－深圳－香港高速鐵路的火車站。

column1: Such an arrangement is fairly uncommon on China's high-speed rail network, as typically high-speed lines are constructed to bypass city cores, where the older "conventional" train stations are.
column2: 這種配置在中國高鐵網中是少見的，因為典型的高鐵路線在建造時會避開「傳統」老式火車站所在的城市中心。

column1: In Shijiazhuang's case, to make it possible to bring the new high-speed railway into the central city, a 5 km (3.1 mi) long railway tunnel was constructed under the city.
column2: 在石家莊，為了讓新建高鐵路線可以進入市中心，興建了一個長達 5 公里（3.1 英哩）的地下鐵路隧道。

column1: This is the first time a high-speed railway has been run under a Chinese city.
column2: 高鐵在城市地下行走，這是中國首例。

column1: There is also a smaller Shijiazhuang North Railway Station, used by trains going west toward Taiyuan without entering Shijiazhuang's city centre.
column2: 有個較小的石家莊北站，主要由向西開往太原，不經石家莊市中心的列車停靠。

column1: The city is served by many expressways, including the Shitai, Beijing–Shenzhen and Taiyuan–Cangzhou Expressways.
column2: 該市擁有多條高速公路，包括石太、北京－深圳、太原－滄州高速公路等。

column1: Line 1 and Line 3 of the Shijiazhuang Metro began operation on June 26, 2017.
column2: 石家莊地鐵 1 號線與 3 號線，於 2017 年 6 月 26 日啟用。

column1: Line 1 Phase 2, Line 2 Phase 1, Line 3 Phase 2 and the remaining two ends of Line 3 Phase 1 are currently under construction.
column2: 目前 1 號線第二期、2 號線第一期、3 號線第二期，以及 3 號線第一期的兩個端點仍在施工中。

column1: Line 1 Phase 2, Line 2 Phase 1, and the two ends of Line 3 Phase 1 will start operation in 2020.
column2: 1 號線第二期、2 號線第一期、三號線第一期兩個端點，將於 2020 年開始營運。

column1: There will be three metro lines extending 80.4 km (50.0 mi)under operation in Shijiazhuang by 2021 when Line 3 Phase 2 completes.
column2: 當 3 號線第二期於 2021 年完工時，石家莊三條地鐵線的營運里程，將達 80.4 公里（50.0 英哩）。

column1: The latest metro plan of Shijiazhuang includes 6 lines in total.
column2: 石家莊最新的地鐵計畫，包括 6 條路線。

column1: The railway company is drafting a new plan of 1,000 km (620 mi)urban rail transit system incorporating metro, urban rapid commuter rail and tramways, and expects there will be 200 km (120 mi)rail transit lines under operation or construction by the end of 13th Five Year Plan (2020).
column2: 鐵路公司正在草擬 1,000 公里（620 英哩）市區鐵路運輸新計畫，包括地鐵、市區快速通勤鐵道、路面電車等，預計於第十三次五年計畫 (2020）結束前，有 200 公里（120英哩）鐵路線開始營運或興建中。

column1: The Shijiazhuang Zhengding International Airport is the province’s center of air transportation.
column2: 石家莊正定國際機場，是該省的航空運輸中心。

column1: It is about 30 kilometers northeast of the city.
column2: 位在該市東北方約 30 公里處。

column1: There are 32 domestic routes arriving at and departing from Shijiazhuang, including destinations such as Shanghai, Shenzhen and Dalian.
column2: 約有 32 條國內航線自石家莊起降，目的地包括上海、深圳、大連等。

column1: The airport serves 12 international destinations including four routes to Russia.
column2: 該機場有 12 條國際航線，其中有 4 條飛往俄羅斯。

column1: The airport is being expanded and will be capable of being an alternate airport to Beijing Capital International Airport.
column2: 該機場正在擴建，可作為北京首都國際機場的替代機場。

column1: With the opening of the Beijing–Guangzhou High-Speed Railway at the end of 2012, the airport got its own train station, making available fast, although infrequent, train service between the airport and Shijiazhuang Railway Station, as well as other stations in the region.
column2: 2012 年末北京－廣州高鐵開通後，機場也設有火車站，雖然班次不多，但可讓石家莊車站與其他區域車站快速通往機場。

column1: Most large roads in the city feature a separate cycle lane and, combined with the city being flat, make it ideal for cycling.
column2: 該市多數大型馬路有獨立的自行車道，再加上地勢平坦，很適合單車。

column1: Thousands of cyclists use the city each day and often there are more cyclists waiting at a crossroad than cars.
column2: 該市每天都有上千名單車騎車，在路口過馬路時，單車往往比汽車還多。

column1: Shijiazhuang is headquarters of the 27th Group Army of the People's Liberation Army, one of the three group armies that comprise the Beijing Military Region responsible for defending China's capital.
column2: 石家莊是人民解放軍第 27 軍總部所在地，是負責保衛首都的北京軍區轄下三個軍的其中之一。

column1: The city of Shijiazhuang is similar to Beijing in that all roads run from north to south and east to west, making the city easy to navigate.
column2: 石家莊市和北京類似，所有道路都是東西向與南北向，因此易於導引。

column1: Many roads have cycle paths making it cyclist friendly.
column2: 許多道路都附設自行車道，對騎士相當友善。

column1: In the heart of the city is the Hebei Museum (Chinese: 河北博物馆;; pinyin: Héběi Bówùguǎn) which was refurbished in 2013 and 2014.
column2: 市中心的河北博物館與 2013 年到 2014 年間進行整修。

column1: It holds regular events, mostly showing traditional Chinese art and artifacts.
column2: 其常設展主要展出傳統中國美術與工藝品。

column1: The Yutong International Sports Centre hosts the Shijiazhuang Ever Bright football matches as well as holding pop concerts.
column2: 裕彤體育館舉辦石家莊永昌足球俱樂部的比賽，並舉辦流行音樂會。

column1: Shijiazhuang Zoo is located on the west side of the city.
column2: 石家莊動物園位於該市西側。

column1: The zoo has 3,000 animals of 250 species including flamingos, golden monkeys, manchurian tigers, Indian elephants, giraffes, chimpanzees, kangaroos, seals, white tigers, springboks and pandas.
column2: 該動物園有 250 種、3,000 隻動物，包括紅鶴、金絲猿、東北虎、印度象、長頸鹿、黑猩猩、海豹、白老虎、跳羚、貓熊等。

column1: Near the Shijiazhuang Zoo are the Botanical Gardens (Chinese: 石家庄植物园), offering a range of exotic and native plants both to view and purchase.
column2: 石家莊植物園位於石家莊動物園附近，內有多種海內外植物可供觀賞選購。

column1: The Martyrs Memorial (Chinese: 烈士纪念馆) can be found in the centre of the city, commemorating the soldiers lost in war.
column2: 烈士紀念館位於市中心，紀念戰役陣亡將士。

column1: Baodu Zhai (Chinese: 抱犊寨; pinyin: Bàodúzhài), or Baodu Village, is an ancient fortified hilltop settlement located on the west side of the city, the mountain contains walks and buddhist statues.
column2: 抱犢寨是一個古老的山頂防禦工事，位於該市西側，山上有步道和佛像。

column1: Close to Baodu Zhai is Fenglong Mountain (Chinese: 封龙山) is situated 5 km (3.1 mi) outside of Shijiazhuang to the west, the mountain features walks and a large stone Buddha statue situated on top of the mountain.
column2: 封龍山在抱犢寨附近，位於石家莊西側 5 公里（3.1英哩）處，山上有步道，山頂也有一尊大型石佛像。

column1: Mount Cangyan (Chinese: 苍岩山; pinyin: Cāngyán Shān; literally: 'Green Cliff Mountain') is a scenic area in Jingxing County, famous for its combination of natural mountain scenery with historical man-made structures.
column2: 蒼岩山是個位於井陘縣的風景區，以其自然山景與歷史建物著名。

column1: It was featured in a scene of the Chinese movie Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon.
column2: 華語電影《臥虎藏龍》即在該地攝製。

column1: The Longxing Temple (Chinese: 隆興寺; pinyin: Lóngxīng Sì) is an ancient Buddhist monastery located just outside the city.
column2: 古佛寺隆興寺就位於市郊。

column1: It has been referred to as the "First Temple south of Beijing".
column2: 該寺享有「北京以南第一寺」的美名。

column1: The Anji Bridge (also known as Zhaozhou Bridge) (simplified Chinese: 安济桥; traditional Chinese: 安濟橋; pinyin: Ānjì Qiáo; literally: 'Safe crossing bridge') is the world's oldest open-spandrel stone segmental arch bridge.
column2: 安濟橋是世界最古老的開孔敞肩坦弧石拱橋。

column1: Credited to the design of a craftsman named Li Chun, the bridge was constructed in the years 595-605 during the Sui dynasty (581–618).
column2: 該橋建於西元 595-605 年的隋朝（581-618）年間，由工匠李春設計興建。

column1: It is the oldest standing bridge in China.
column2: 是中國最古老的拱橋。

column1: The Pagoda of Bailin Temple (Chinese: 从谂禅师舍利塔; pinyin: Cóngshěn Chánshī Shělìtǎ or 赵州塔; Zhàozhōu Tǎ) is an octagonal-based brick Chinese pagoda built in 1330 during the reign of Emperor Wenzong, ruler of the Mongol-led Yuan Dynasty (1271–1368).
column2: 柏林禪寺中的從諗禪師舍利塔，是一座中國式磚造八角寶塔，建於蒙古人政權元朝（1271-1368）元文宗統治期間的 1330 年。

column1: Shijiazhuang city centre contains a range of parks.

column1: For a time, Gulangyu had the peculiarity of having constituted the only international settlement on Chinese soil apart from the more celebrated International Settlement at Shanghai.

column1: Soon after Xiamen became a treaty port resulting from China's loss in the First Opium War and the Treaty of Nanking in 1842, foreign residents on the island established an informal organization that became formally organized several decades later when its Land Regulations were approved by the government of China in May 1902.
column2: 1842 年中國打輸第一次鴉片戰爭，簽下南京條約，使廈門成為通商口岸後，島上的外國居民成立了非正式的組織，而在數十年後的 1902 年 5 月政府核准該島的規範後，成為正式的組織。

column1: Eventually 13 countries, including Great Britain, France, The Netherlands and Japan, were to enjoy extraterritorial privileges there and take part in the Kulangsu Municipal Council that administered the settlement.
column2: 最終有 13 國，包括英國、法國、荷蘭、日本等，可以享有治外法權，在居地參與鼓浪嶼參議會。

column1: As with the Shanghai International Settlement, the British played a predominant role in the administration and Sikh policemen from British India were charged with the policing of the Settlement under the Kulangsu Municipal Police.
column2: 如同上海公共租界，英國在行政方面扮演重要角色，派任英屬印度的錫克警察，受鼓浪嶼警局管轄，維持租界治安。

column1: The consulates, churches, hospitals, schools, police stations, etc. built by those foreign communities explain the predominantly Victorian-era style architecture that can still be seen throughout Gulangyu.
column2: 由外國社區建立的領事館、教堂、學校、警察局等，是整個鼓浪嶼仍留存許多維多利亞時代風格建築的主因。

column2: 北平烤鴨之名在晚明一代逐漸發展起來，當時北平烤鴨是宮廷菜單上的一道主菜。

column1: The first restaurant specialising in Peking Duck, Bianyifang, was established in the Xianyukou, close to Qianmen of Beijing in 1416.
column2: 第一家專精北平烤鴨的餐廳便宜坊，於 1416 年成立於北京前口附近的鮮魚口。

column1: By the Qianlong Period (1736–1796) of the Qing dynasty, the popularity of Peking Duck spread to the upper classes, inspiring poetry from poets and scholars who enjoyed the dish.
column2: 在清朝乾隆年間（1736-1796），北平烤鴨在上層階級開始普及，給了許多嗜食此物的詩人與文士許多靈感。

column1: For instance, one verse of Dūmén zhúzhīcí, a Beijing local poem was, "Fill your plates with roast duck and suckling pig".
column2: 例如在《Dumen zhuzhici》中的一首北京當地詩句，就提到「以烤鴨和乳豬盛盤」。

column1: In 1864, the Quanjude (全聚德) restaurant was established in Beijing.
column2: 1864 年全聚德餐廳於北京成立。

column1: Yang Quanren (楊全仁), the founder of Quanjude, developed the hung oven to roast ducks.
column2: 全聚德創始人楊全仁發明了烤鴨用的烘爐。

column1: With its innovations and efficient management, the restaurant became well known in China, introducing the Peking Duck to the rest of the world.
column2: 由於其創新與便於管理，該餐廳變得聞名全中國，且讓北平烤鴨之名傳遍世界。

column1: By the mid-20th century, Peking Duck had become a national symbol of China, favored by tourists and diplomats alike.
column2: 二十世紀中期，北平烤鴨已成為中國的象徵，受觀光客與外交人員喜愛。

column1: For example, Henry Kissinger, the Secretary of State of the United States, met Premier Zhou Enlai in the Great Hall of the People on July 10, 1971, during his first (secret) visit to China.
column2: 例如美國國務卿季辛吉，於 1971 年 7 月 10 日首次訪問中國時，在人民大會堂拜會周恩來。

column1: After a round of inconclusive talks in the morning, the delegation was served Peking Duck for lunch, which became Kissinger's favourite.
column2: 在早上一輪沒有結論的會談後，午餐的菜色是北平烤鴨，後來成為季辛吉的最愛。

column1: The Americans and Chinese issued a joint statement the following day, inviting President Richard Nixon to visit China in 1972.
column2: 隔日發表中美聯合聲明，並邀請尼克森總統於 1972 年訪問中國。

column1: Following Zhou's death in 1976, Kissinger paid another visit to Beijing to savor Peking Duck.
column2: 1976 年周恩來去世後，季辛吉再度訪問北京，享用北平烤鴨的美味。

column1: Peking Duck, at the Quanjude in particular, has also been a favorite dish for various political leaders ranging from Cuban Fidel Castro to former German chancellor Helmut Kohl.
column2: 北平烤鴨，特別是全聚德的，已成為各國政要如卡斯楚、德國總理柯爾等人的最愛餐點。

column1: Two notable restaurants in Beijing which serve this dish are Quanjude and Bianyifang, both centuries-old establishments which have become household names, each with their own style: Quanjude is known for using the hung oven roasting method, while Bianyifang uses the oldest technique of closed oven roasting.
column2: 北京最有名的兩家餐廳是全聚德與便宜坊兩家百年老店，不但街坊聞名，且各有特色：全聚德以其烘爐烤法聞名，便宜坊則使用閉爐古法。

column1: Fattened ducks are slaughtered, plucked, eviscerated and rinsed thoroughly with water.
column2: 育肥的鴨隻，在屠宰後拔毛、取出內臟，並且以水完全洗淨。

column1: Air is pumped under the skin through the neck cavity to separate the skin from the fat.
column2: 接著自頸部開孔，灌入空氣，以將皮肉分開。

column1: The duck is then plunged in boiling water for 1 to 5 minutes, and then hung to dry.
column2: 接著將鴨過滾水約1到5分鐘，接著掛起晾乾。

column1: This will tighten the skin and help the duck to achieve its traditional crispy texture.
column2: 這會讓鴨皮緊繃，以創造出傳統的鴨皮酥脆口感。

column1: The duck is then glazed with a layer of potentially spiced and flavored maltose syrup, and the inside is rinsed once more with water.
column2: 之後在鴨身抹上一層加有香辛料的麥芽糖漿，內部再以清水洗淨一次。

column1: A marinade of traditional flavorings, including soy sauce and five-spice powder, and more maltose, is then applied inside the body cavity.
column2: 接著自鴨身開口處灌入含有醬油、五香粉、大量麥芽糖的傳統滷汁。

column1: This will flavor the duck during the next step.
column2: 這樣在接下來的步驟中，即可讓鴨肉入味。

column1: The duck is then left to dry for between 24 hours and several days in a cool, dry place (or a refrigerator).
column2: 之後將鴨子置於乾冷處（或是冰箱內）存放 24 小時至數天，以便乾燥。

column1: The drying allows the skin to crisp while roasting.
column2: 乾燥過程可讓鴨皮在烘烤時變得酥脆。

column1: It is then roasted in an oven until the skin turns shiny brown.
column2: 接著放入爐中烘烤，烤到鴨皮變得油亮棕色為止。

column1: While roasting, hot water is added to the body cavity as needed to ensure even cooking and tenderness.
column2: 烘烤時，必須將熱水注入鴨身中，以確保均勻烘烤，肉質柔軟。

column1: Some preparations involve the duck being smoked with fruity woods.
column2: 需要準備一些果樹木頭來燻烤鴨身。

column1: Besides traditional methods to prepare Peking Duck, recipes have been compiled by chefs around the world to produce the dish at home.
column2: 除了傳統北平烤鴨製法外，各國廚師也發明多種在家調理的食譜。

column1: Peking duck is originally roasted in a closed oven (Chinese: 焖炉), and Bianyifang is the restaurant that keeps this tradition.
column2: 北平烤鴨傳統上使用燜爐來烤，便宜坊就是採取這種古法。

column1: The closed oven is built of brick and fitted with metal griddles (Chinese: 箅子; pinyin: bì zi).
column2: 燜爐以磚塊砌成，內有金屬箅子。

column1: The oven is preheated by burning Gaoliang sorghum straw (Chinese: 秫秸; pinyin: shú jiē) at the base.
column2: 這種烤爐要在底部燃燒秫秸進行預熱。

column1: The duck is placed in the oven immediately after the fire burns out, allowing the meat to be slowly cooked through the convection of heat within the oven.
column2: 當火熄滅後，要立即將鴨子放入烤爐內，讓爐子內的餘熱緩緩將鴨子烤熟。

column1: Controlling the fuel and the temperature is the main skill.
column2: 主要的技巧是控制燃料與溫度。

column1: In closed-oven style, duck meat is combined well with the fat under the skin, and therefore is juicy and tender.
column2: 以燜爐方式製作，鴨肉會與皮下脂肪結合，使得口感綿密而多汁。

column1: The open oven (Chinese: 挂炉; literally: 'hung oven') was developed in the imperial kitchens during the Qing Dynasty, and adopted by the Quanjude restaurant chain.
column2: 掛爐是在清宮御膳房中發展出來的，全聚德連鎖餐廳加以發揚光大。

column1: It is designed to roast up to 20 ducks at the same time with an open fire fueled by hardwood from peach or pear trees.
column2: 其設計可以透過燃燒桃樹或梨樹枝，一次烤 20 隻鴨。

column1: The ducks are hung on hooks above the fire and roasted at a temperature of 270 °C (525 °F) for 30–40 minutes.
column2: 鴨子掛在爐火上的勾子，以攝氏 270 度（華氏 525 度）烤 30-40 分鐘。

column1: While the ducks are roasting, the chef may use a pole to dangle each duck closer to the fire for 30-second intervals.
column2: 在烤鴨時，主廚會用一根桿子去晃每隻鴨子，讓鴨子接近爐火約 30 秒。

column1: In open-oven style, the fat is usually melted during the cooking process, so the skin is crispy, and can be eaten separately as a snack.
column2: 掛爐烤法中，脂肪會在過程中融化，皮會變得酥脆，可以另作為一道小點。

column1: Almost every part of a duck can be prepared afterwards.
column2: 之後鴨子全身上下皆可食用。

column1: Quanjude Restaurant served their customers the "All Duck Banquet" in which they cooked the bones of ducks with vegetables.
column2: 全聚德提供給顧客的「全鴨席」，包括佐以蔬菜的烤鴨骨。

column1: The cooked Peking Duck is traditionally carved in front of the diners and served in three stages.
column2: 傳統上，烤好的鴨子會在客人面前片鴨，且分三次上菜。

column1: First, the duck skin is served with sugar and garlic sauce as dip.
column2: 首先，鴨皮會和糖與蒜醬當做前菜。

column1: The skin tastes better while remaining warm, but it will cool down fast.
column2: 鴨皮尚存餘溫時最為美味，不過很快就會冷掉。

column1: The meat is then served with steamed pancakes (simplified Chinese: 春饼; traditional Chinese: 春餅; pinyin: chūn bǐng), spring onions and sweet bean sauce.
column2: 鴨肉會與蒸春餅、蔥與甜麵醬一同上菜。

column1: Several vegetable dishes are provided to accompany the meat, typically cucumber sticks.
column2: 會有多種蔬菜與肉一同食用，通常是小黃瓜。

column1: Some restaurants offer watermelon radish sticks as alternative.
column2: 其他餐廳會以紅心蘿蔔替代。

column1: The diners spread sauce over the pancake.
column2: 食客要把醬汁淋上麵餅。

column1: Traditionally, the pancake is wrapped around the meat and spring onion, then eaten by hand.
column2: 傳統上要以麵餅裹著鴨肉與蔥，以手持食用。

column1: Cucumber sticks are eaten as refreshment between Peking Duck rolls, but can also be rolled in the pancake.
column2: 吃完鴨肉捲後，可以吃小黃瓜以去油，也可以捲進麵餅裡。

column1: The remaining duck (鸭架) can be cooked in three ways.
column2: 剩下的鴨架有三種料理方式。

column1: The traditional way is to be cooked into a broth.
column2: 傳統料理法是煮湯。

column1: The meat together with bones can also be stir-fried with sweet bean sauce, or rapidly sautéed and served with salt and Sichuan pepper (椒鹽).
column2: 肉與骨會以甜麵醬拌炒，或是以四川椒鹽快炒。

column1: Otherwise, they are packed up to be taken home by the customers.
column2: 此外，還可以讓顧客打包帶回家。

column1: Whole Peking Ducks can be ordered as takeaways.
column2: 北平烤全鴨也可以外帶。

column1: The ducks can be reheated at home with an oven, grill or boiling oil.
column2: 帶回家的鴨子可以用烤爐回烤、火烤，或以熱油回溫。

column1: When an oven is used, the duck is heated at a temperature of 150 °C (300 °F) for 20 minutes, and then at 160 °C (325 °F) for another 10 minutes.
column2: 使用烤箱的話，以攝氏 150 度（華氏 300 度）回烤 20 分鐘，再以攝氏 160 度（華氏 325 度）再烤 10 分鐘。

column1: The grilling method involves filling the duck with boiling water before placing it on a griddle, 70 cm (28 in) above the cooking fire.
column2: 火烤法要先將鴨肉注以滾水，然後上烤架，離火約 70 公分（28 英吋）。

column1: The boiling water is replaced every 3–4 minutes until the duck's skin is piping hot.
column2: 滾水每 3-4 分鐘要更換一次，直到鴨皮滾燙為止。

column1: To reheat the Peking Duck with oil, the duck is sliced into thin pieces and placed in a strainer held over a wok of boiling oil.
column2: 以油加熱北平烤鴨，鴨要先切成薄片，放在濾網上，很快過一鍋滾油。

column1: The duck is then rinsed several times with the oil.
column2: 鴨肉要在熱油中浸泡數次。

column1: A number of restaurants in Beijing specialise in Peking Duck.
column2: 在北京有不少餐廳精於烤鴨。

column1: Examples include Quanjude, Bianyifang, Changan Yihao (長安一號), Dayali, Beijing Xiaowangfu (北京小王府) and Dadong Kaoyadian (大董烤鴨店).
column2: 除了全聚德、便宜坊外，長安一號、大鴨梨、北京小王府、大董烤鴨店都相當知名。

column1: Some restaurants, in particular Quanjude and Bianyifang, have long histories of serving high quality duck that they are now household names, or Lao zihao (老字號), literally "old brand name".
column2: 某些餐廳，尤其是全聚德和便宜坊，長期以來供應高級烤鴨，現在成為了「老字號」。

column1: In addition, Quanjude has received worldwide recognition, having been named a China Renowned Trademark in 1999.
column2: 此外，全聚德在海外也相當知名，在 1999 年獲得中國馳名商標頭銜。

column1: Crispy aromatic duck (香酥鴨 xiang su ya) is a similar dish to Peking duck.
column2: 香酥鴨是類似於北平烤鴨的菜色。

column1: It is very popular in the United Kingdom, where it was created in the latter half of the twentieth century.
column2: 這道菜在英國相當流行，是於 20 世紀後半創造出來的。

column1: The duck is first marinated with spices, then steamed until tender, and finally deep fried until crispy.
column2: 鴨子會先以香料滷汁浸泡，然後蒸熟，最後炸到酥脆。

column1: The meat has less fat and is drier and crispier compared to that of Peking Duck.
column2: 和北平烤鴨相比，肉質比較不油、較乾脆。

column1: Crispy aromatic duck can also be seen in the United States, usually served with buns rather than pancakes.
column2: 香酥鴨在美國也常見，多半是佐以包子而非麵餅。

column1: In Germany, some Asian fusion restaurants also serve crispy aromatic duck (Knusprige Ente), sometimes also labeled as Peking Duck (Peking-Ente, also Pekingente).
column2: 在德國，某些亞洲複合餐廳也會提供香酥鴨；有時會標示為北平烤鴨。

column1: The duck is marinated with spices and deep-fried, served together with stir-fried vegetables (Wokgemüse) over fried noodles or with rice.
column2: 鴨子會以滷汁醃後大火油炸，同時佐以烤蔬菜與炸麵條或米飯。

column2: 中國交通建設公司的前身可以追溯到清朝，於 1905 年設立的 Junpu 工程局。
