column1: A large dam across the Yangtze River was originally envisioned by Sun Yat-sen in The International Development of China, in 1919.
column2: 橫跨長江的大水壩構想，最早出自1919年孫中山撰寫的《建國方略》。

column1: He stated that a dam capable of generating 30 million horsepower (22 GW) was possible downstream of the Three Gorges.
column2: 他說可以在三峽下游建立水壩，能產生3,000萬馬力（22GW）。

column1: In 1932, the Nationalist government, led by Chiang Kai-shek, began preliminary work on plans in the Three Gorges.
column2: 1932 年， 由蔣介石領導的國民政府，開始規劃三峽工程。

column1: In 1939, Japanese military forces occupied Yichang and surveyed the area.
column2: 1939年，日軍佔領宜昌，並且調查該區。

column1: A design, the Otani plan, was completed for the dam in anticipation of a Japanese victory over China.
column2: 該設計「大谷計畫」將在日本擊敗中國後建成大壩。

column1: In 1944, the United States Bureau of Reclamation head design engineer, John L. Savage, surveyed the area and drew up a dam proposal for the 'Yangtze River Project'.
column2: 1944 年美國墾務主任設計工程師 John L. Savage 調查該區域，提出「長江計畫」大壩提案。

column1: Some 54 Chinese engineers went to the U.S. for training.
column2: 約 54 名中國工程師赴美受訓。

column1: The original plans called for the dam to employ a unique method for moving ships; the ships would move into locks located at the lower and upper ends of the dam and then cranes with cables would move the ships from one lock to the next.
column2: 該大壩計畫原本打算採用一種獨特方法來移動船隻；船先開入低水位區與高水位區的水閘，然後以吊車與纜索將船移動到下一個水匣。

column1: In the case of smaller water craft, groups of craft would be lifted together for efficiency.
column2: 如果是較小的船隻，可以編組同時移動，以提高效率。

column1: It is not known whether this solution was considered for its water-saving performance or because the engineers thought the difference in height between the river above and below the dam too great for alternative methods.
column2: 目前不知道考慮這種解決方案的原因，是為了要省水，還是因為工程師認為大壩高低差太大，其他方式不可行。

column1: Some exploration, survey, economic study, and design work was done, but the government, in the midst of the Chinese Civil War, halted work in 1947.
column2: 當時已經完成探勘、調查、經費研究與設計工作，但因中國內戰打到一半，1947 年時政府停止該計畫。

column1: After the 1949 Communist takeover, Mao Zedong supported the project, but began the Gezhouba Dam project nearby first, and economic problems including the Great Leap Forward and the Cultural Revolution slowed progress.
column2: 1949 年共產黨奪權後，毛澤東雖然支持該計畫，但先進行附近的葛州壩計畫，而且因大躍進與文革造成的經濟問題，也拖延了計畫。

column1: After the 1954 Yangtze River Floods, in 1956, Mao Zedong authored "Swimming", a poem about his fascination with a dam on the Yangtze River.
column2: 1954 年長江洪災後，1956 年時毛澤東寫了《游泳》一詩，指出他對在長江築壩的執著。

column1: In 1958, after the Hundred Flowers Campaign, some engineers who spoke out against the project were imprisoned.
column2: 1958 年百花齊放運動後，一些公開主張反對該計畫的人被捕入獄。

column1: During the 1980s, the idea of a dam reemerged.
column2: 1980 年代，大壩計畫再度開始討論。

column1: The National People's Congress approved the dam in 1992: out of 2,633 delegates, 1,767 voted in favour, 177 voted against, 664 abstained, and 25 members did not vote.
column2: 1992年人民大會通過大壩興建案，2,633 名代表中，1,767 名投贊成票，664 名反對，25 人未投票。

column1: Construction started on December 14, 1994. The dam was expected to be fully operational in 2009, but additional projects, such as the underground power plant with six additional generators, delayed full operation until May 2012.
column2: 建築工程自 1994 年 12 月 14 日開始。預計壩體於 2009 年可完全運作，但由於新增的計畫，例如地下水力發電廠新增六具發電機組，使完全運轉拖到 2012 年 5 月。

column1: The ship lift was completed in 2015.
column2: 船塢於 2015 年完工。

column1: The dam had raised the water level in the reservoir to 172.5 m (566 ft) above sea level by the end of 2008 and the designed maximum level of 175 m (574 ft) by October 2010.
column2: 大壩讓水庫水位於 2008 年底升至海拔 172.5 公尺（566 英呎），設計最高水位將於 2010 年 10 月到達 175 公尺（574 英呎）。

column1: Made of concrete and steel, the dam is 2,335 m (7,661 ft) long and the top of the dam is 185 m (607 ft) above sea level.
column2: 壩體以鋼筋水泥建成，長 2,335 公尺（ 7,661 英呎），最高處達海拔 185 公尺（607 英呎）。

column1: The project used 27.2×10⁶ m³ (35.6×10⁶ cu yd) of concrete (mainly for the dam wall), used 463,000 T of steel (enough to build 63 Eiffel Towers), and moved about 102.6×10⁶ m³ (134.2×10⁶ cu yd) of earth.
column2: 該計畫使用了 27.2×10⁶ 立方公尺 (35.6×10⁶ 立方碼) 的水泥（主要用於壩體），並使用 463,000 噸鋼材 （足以建造 63 座巴黎鐵塔），並且搬運了 102.6×10⁶ 立方公尺 (134.2×10⁶ 立方碼）的土方。

column1: The concrete dam wall is 181 m (594 ft) high above the rock basis.
column2: 水泥壩體在岩盤上方 181 公尺（594 英呎）。

column1: When the water level is at its maximum of 175 m (574 ft) above sea level, 110 m (361 ft) higher than the river level downstream, the dam reservoir is on average about 660 km (410 mi) in length and 1.12 km (3,675 ft) in width.
column2: 達到最高水位海拔 175 公尺（574 英呎）時，會比河川下游高 110 公尺（361 英呎），水庫平均長 660 公里（410 英哩）、寬 1.12 公里（3,675 英呎）。

column1: It contains 39.3 km³ (31,900,000 acre⋅ft) of water and has a total surface area of 1,045 km² (403 sq mi).
column2: 內含 39.3 立方公里（31,900,000 立方英呎）的水，總面積達 1,045 平方公里（403 平方英哩）。

column1: On completion, the reservoir flooded a total area of 632 km² (244 sq mi) of land, compared to the 1,350 km² (520 sq mi) of reservoir created by the Itaipu Dam.
column2: 完工後，水庫淹沒土地廣達 632 平方公里（244 平方英哩），而伊泰普水壩的庫區則為 1,350 平方公里（520 平方英哩）。

column1: The government estimated that the Three Gorges Dam project would cost 180 billion yuan (US$22.5 billion).
column2: 政府估計三峽大壩工程將耗資 1,800 億元人民幣（225 億美元）。

column1: By the end of 2008, spending had reached 148.365 billion yuan, among which 64.613 billion yuan was spent on construction, 68.557 billion yuan on relocating affected residents, and 15.195 billion yuan on financing.
column2: 2008 年底，耗資將達 1,483.65 億元人民幣，其中 646.13 億元用於工程建設、685.57 億元用於受影響居民搬遷、151.95 億元用於財務。

column1: It was estimated in 2009 that the construction cost would be recovered when the dam had generated 1,000 terawatt-hours (3,600 PJ) of electricity, yielding 250 billion yuan.
column2: 2009 年時估計建設經費將在大壩發電達 1,000 太瓦時（3,600 皮焦耳）時損益兩平，收入將達 2,500 億元人民幣。

column1: Full cost recovery was thus expected to occur ten years after the dam started full operation, but the full cost of the Three Gorges Dam was recovered by December 20, 2013.
column2: 預計將在大壩完全運轉十年後完成弭平支出，實際上的支出完全弭平是在 2013 年 12 月 20 日。

column1: Funding sources include the Three Gorges Dam Construction Fund, profits from the Gezhouba Dam, loans from the China Development Bank, loans from domestic and foreign commercial banks, corporate bonds, and revenue from both before and after the dam is fully operational.
column2: 資金來源包括三峽大壩建設基金、葛州壩收益、自國家開發銀行的貸款、國內外商業銀行貸款、公司債，以及大壩完全運轉前後的收入。

column1: Additional charges were assessed as follows: Every province receiving power from the Three Gorges Dam had to pay ¥7.00 per MWh extra.
column2: 另外也徵收下列費用：每個使用三峽大壩電力的省份，每百萬度電要支付人民幣 7 元。

column1: Other provinces had to pay an additional charge of ¥4.00 per MWh.
column2: 其他省份必須支付每百萬度電 4 元。

column1: The Tibet Autonomous Region pays no surcharge.
column2: 西藏自治區不用付費。

column1: Power generation is managed by China Yangtze Power, a listed subsidiary of China Three Gorges Corporation (CTGC)—a Central Enterprise SOE administered by SASAC.
column2: 發電由國務院國有資產監督管理委員會所屬中央國營企業中國長江三峽集團公司旗下的長江電力公司管理。

column1: The Three Gorges Dam is the world's largest capacity hydroelectric power station with 34 generators: 32 main generators, each with a capacity of 700 MW, and two plant power generators, each with capacity of 50 MW, making a total capacity of 22,500 MW.
column2: 三峽大壩是世界上容量最大的水力發電廠，有 34 個發電機組，包括 32 個主發電機組，單一機組容量為 700 MW、以及兩台發電容量為 50 MW 的發電機組，總容量達 22,500 MW。

column1: Among those 32 main generators, 14 are installed in the north side of the dam, 12 in the south side, and the remaining six in the underground power plant in the mountain south of the dam.
column2: 在 32 台主要機組中，14 台設於大壩北側，12 台於南側，其餘 6 台設於大壩南方山區的地下電廠內。

column1: Annual electricity generation in 2015 was 87 TWh, which is 20 times more than the Hoover Dam.
column2: 2015 年的年發電量達 87 太瓦時，是胡佛水壩的 20 倍。

column1: The main generators weigh about 6,000 tonnes each and are designed to produce more than 700 MW of power.
column2: 主發電機組重達 6,000 噸，設計發電容量為 700 MW。

column1: The designed head of the generator is 80.6 meters (264 ft).
column2: 設計發電水位高度 80.6 公尺 (264 英呎）。

column1: The flow rate varies between 600–950 cubic metres per second (21,000–34,000 cu ft/s) depending on the head available.
column2: 每秒流量為 600-950 立方公尺不等（每秒 21,000- 34,000 立方英呎）， 依水位高低而不等。

column1: The greater the head, the less water needed to reach full power.
column2: 水位愈高，全力發電所需的水量愈少。

column1: Three Gorges uses Francis turbines.
column2: 三峽大壩使用法蘭西斯式水輪機。

column1: Turbine diameter is 9.7/10.4 m (VGS design/Alstom's design) and rotation speed is 75 revolutions per minute.
column2: 輪機直徑為 9.7/10.4 公尺（VGS設計/Alstom 設計），轉速為每分鐘 75 轉。

column1: This means that in order to generate power at 50 Hz, the generator rotors have 80 poles.
column2: 也就是說為了產生 50Hz 的電力，發電機轉子有 80 極。

column1: Rated power is 778 MVA, with a maximum of 840 MVA and a power factor of 0.9.
column2: 額定電力為 778MVA，最大 840MVA，功率因數為 0.9。

column1: The generator produces electrical power at 20 kV.
column2: 發電機產生電力為 20kV。

column1: The electricity generated is then stepped-up to 500 kV for transmission at 50 Hz.
column2: 電力隨即升壓至 500KV，變換為 50Hz。

column1: The outer diameter of the generator stator is 21.4/20.9 m.
column2: 發電機出水口定子直徑為 21.4/20.9 公尺。

column1: The inner diameter is 18.5/18.8 m.
The stator, the biggest of its kind, is 3.1/3 m in height.
column2: 定子為該類中最大者，高達 3.1/3 公尺。

column1: Bearing load is 5050/5500 tonnes.
Average efficiency is over 94%, and reaches 96.5%.
column2: 平均效率為 94% 以上，達到 96.5%。

column1: The generators were manufactured by two joint ventures: one of them Alstom, ABB Group, Kvaerner, and the Chinese company Harbin Motor; the other Voith, General Electric, Siemens (abbreviated as VGS), and the Chinese company Oriental Motor.
column2: 發電機組由兩家合資公司承製：一家是 Alstom、ABB 集團、Kvaerner 與中國公司哈爾濱馬達合作，另一家為 Voith、奇異、西門子（合稱 VGS）與中國公司東方馬達合作。

column1: The technology transfer agreement was signed together with the contract.
column2: 在簽署合約時也簽署技術移轉同意書。

column1: Most of the generators are water-cooled.
column2: 多數發電機採用水冷。

column1: Some newer ones are air-cooled, which are simpler in design and manufacture and are easier to maintain.
column2: 部分新機組為氣冷式，設計製作簡單且易於維護。

column1: The first north side main generator (No. 2) started on July 10, 2003; the north side became completely operational September 7, 2005, with the implementation of generator No. 9.
column2: 北側第一部機組（2號）於 2003 年 7 月 10 日啟用；北側於 9 號機於 2005 年 9 月 7 日啟用後完全運轉。

column1: Full power (9,800 MW) was only reached on October 18, 2006, after the water level reached 156 m.
column2: 2006 年 10 月 18 日當水位來到 156 公尺時，達成滿載輸出（9,800 MW）。

column1: The 12 south side main generators are also in operation.
column2: 12 部南側機組也加入運轉。

column1: No. 22 began operation on June 11, 2007, and No. 15 started up on October 30, 2008. The sixth (No. 17) began operation on December 18, 2007, raising capacity to 14.1 GW, finally surpassing Itaipu (14.0 GW), to become the world's largest hydro power plant by capacity.
column2: 2007 年 6 月 11 日，第 22 號機組啟用，第 15 號機組於 2008 年 10月30日啟用。第6機組（17號）於 2007 年 12 月 18 日啟用，總容量升至 14.1 GW，超過伊泰普（14.0 GW），成為全球容量最大的水力發電廠。

column1: As of May 23, 2012, when the last main generator, No. 27, finished its final test, the six underground main generators are also in operation, raising capacity to 22.5 GW.
column2: 截至 2012 年5月23日，最後的主要機組 27 號機完成最終測試後，第6地下主要機組也開始運轉，容量增至 22.5GW。

column1: After nine years of construction, installation and testing, the power plant is now fully operational.
column2: 歷經 9 年興建、安裝、測試後，電廠現已全面運轉。

column1: The State Grid Corporation and China Southern Power Grid paid a flat rate of ¥250 per MWh (US$35.7) until July 2, 2008.
column2: 國家電網有限公司與中國南方電網，在 2008 年 7 月 2 日前支付固定費率每 MWh 250 元人民幣（35.7 美元）。

column1: Since then, the price has varied by province, from ¥228.7–401.8 per MWh.
column2: 之後，電價依各省而不同，約為每 MWh 228.7-401.8 元人民幣。

column1: Higher-paying customers, such as Shanghai, receive priority.
column2: 像上海這樣付高價的客戶，擁有優先權。

column1: Nine provinces and two cities consume power from the dam.
column2: 共有九省、二市使用大壩電力。

column1: Power distribution and transmission infrastructure cost about 34.387 billion Yuan.
column2: 電力配送基礎設施耗資近 343.87 億人民幣。

column1: Construction was completed in December 2007, one year ahead of schedule.
column2: 工程於 2007 年 12 月完工，較計畫提前一年。

column1: Power is distributed over multiple 500 kilovolt (kV) transmission lines.
column2: 電力經由多條 500 kV 傳輸線路配送。

column1: Three direct current (DC) lines to the East China Grid carry 7,200 MW: Three Gorges – Shanghai (3,000 MW), HVDC Three Gorges – Changzhou (3,000 MW), and HVDC Gezhouba – Shanghai (1,200 MW).
column2: 三條往華東直流輸電線路輸送 7,200 MW：三峽-上海（3,000 MW）、HVDC 三峽-常州 (3,000 MW）、HVDC 葛州壩-上海（1,200 MW）。

column1: The alternating current (AC) lines to the Central China Grid have a total capacity of 12,000 MW. The DC transmission line HVDC Three Gorges – Guangdong to the South China Grid has a capacity of 3,000 MW.
column2: 往華中電網的交流電總容量為 12,000 MW。直流輸電線路 HVDC 三峽-廣東輸往華南電網，容量 3,000 MW。

column1: The dam was expected to provide 10% of China's power.
column2: 大壩預計提供中國 10% 供電。

column1: However, electricity demand has increased more quickly than previously projected.
column2: 然而，用電需求成長遠高於預期。

column1: Even fully operational, on average, it supports only about 1.7% of electricity demand in China in the year of 2011, when the Chinese electricity demand reached 4692.8 TWh.
column2: 即使全力運轉，中國用電量於 2011 年將達 4692.8 TWh，該電廠只能提供 1.7%。

column1: According to the National Development and Reform Commission of China, 366 grams of coal would produce 1 kWh of electricity during 2006.
column2: 根據國家發改委估計，2006 年時 366 克煤可產生 1kWh 電力。

column1: At full power, Three Gorges reduces coal consumption by 31 million tonnes per year, avoiding 100 million tonnes of greenhouse gas emissions, millions of tonnes of dust, one million tonnes of sulfur dioxide, 370,000 tonnes of nitric oxide, 10,000 tonnes of carbon monoxide, and a significant amount of mercury.
column2: 滿載運轉時，三峽大壩可以減少煤炭用量達每年 3,100 萬噸，避免排放 1 億噸溫室氣體，數百萬噸塵埃、100 萬噸二氧化硫、37 萬噸氮氧化物、1 萬噸一氧化碳、以及為數可觀的汞。

column1: Hydropower saves the energy needed to mine, wash, and transport the coal from northern China.
column2: 水力發電取代自中國北方挖掘、洗選、運送煤炭所需的能源。

column1: From 2003 to 2007, power production equaled that of 84 million tonnes of standard coal, reducing carbon dioxide by 190 million tonnes, sulfur dioxide by 2.29 million tonnes, and nitrogen oxides by 980,000 tonnes.
column2: 2003 至 2007 年，其發電相當於 8,400 萬噸標準煤，減少 1,900 萬噸二氧化碳、 22.9 萬噸二氧化硫、98 萬噸氮氧化物。

column1: The dam increased the Yangtze's barge capacity sixfold, reducing carbon dioxide emission by 630,000 tonnes.
column2: 大壩增加長江運量達 6 倍，減少 63 萬噸二氧化碳排放。

column1: From 2004 to 2007, a total of 198 million tonnes of goods passed through the ship locks.
column2: 2004 - 2007 年，共有 1.98 億噸貨物自水閘進出。

column1: Compared to using trucking, barges reduced carbon dioxide emission by ten million tonnes and lowered costs by 25%.
column2: 相較於卡車運輸，水運降低碳排達 1,000 萬噸，成本降低 25%。

column1: Erosion in the reservoir, induced by rising water, causes frequent major landslides that have led to noticeable disturbance in the reservoir surface, including two incidents in May 2009 when somewhere between 20,000 and 50,000 cubic metres (26,000 and 65,000 cu yd) of material plunged into the flooded Wuxia Gorge of the Wu River.
column2: 水位上升造成的水庫侵蝕，經常產生大型崩塌，使得水庫表面發生可注意到的擾流，包括 2009 年 5 月的兩起事故，當時在某處有 2 萬到5 萬立方公尺（26,000 及 65,000 立方碼）的物體掉落至巫峽所在的烏江。

column1: Also, in the first four months of 2010, there were 97 significant landslides.
column2: 而在 2010 年頭四個月，就發生 97 起大型山崩。

column1: The dam catalyzed improved upstream wastewater treatment around Chongqing and its suburban areas.
column2: 大壩也激發重慶及其郊區上游廢水處理的改善。

column1: According to the Ministry of Environmental Protection, as of April 2007, more than 50 new plants could treat 1.84 million tonnes per day, 65% of the total need.
column2: 根據環保部門統計，截至 2007 年 4 月，新增 50 處以上廢水處理廠，每日可處理 184 萬噸廢水，達需求的 65%。

column1: About 32 landfills were added, which could handle 7,664.5 tonnes of solid waste every day.
column2: 新增 32 處掩埋廠，每日可以處理 7,664.5 噸固體廢棄物。

column1: Over one billion tons of wastewater are released annually into the river, which was more likely to be swept away before the reservoir was created.
column2: 每年有超過 10 億噸廢水注入河中，在水庫建成前必須掃除。

column1: This has left the water looking stagnant, polluted and murky.
column2: 這會造成水流停滯、污染並且發黑。

column1: In 1997, the Three Gorges area had 10% forestation, down from 20% in the 1950s.
column2: 1950 年代三峽壩區原有 20% 造林地，1997 年降為 10%。

column1: Research by the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization suggested that the Asia-Pacific region would, overall, gain about 6,000 km² (2,300 sq mi) of forest by 2008.
column2: 聯合國糧農組織的研究指出，亞太地區在 2008 年前的森林面積應增加 6,000 平方公里（2,300 平方英哩）。

column1: That is a significant change from the 13,000 km² (5,000 sq mi) net loss of forest each year in the 1990s.
column2: 1990 年代，每年損失 13,000 平方公里（5,000 平方英哩）森林，這是很大的改變。

column2: 上海擁有中國最熟練的工廠工人，成為中國工業中心，因此在1950年代和60年代成為激進左翼思想的中心。

column1: The radical leftist Jiang Qing and her three allies, together the Gang of Four, were based in the city.
column2: 激進左翼分子江青和其三個盟友，以及四人幫，都出身該市。

column1: During the Cultural Revolution (1966–1976), Shanghai's society was severely damaged, with 310,000 wrongful convictions involving more than 1 million people.
column2: 1966 年到 1976 年的文革期間，上海社會遭到嚴重破壞，有 310,000 件誤判有罪案件，涉及一百萬人。

column1: About 11,500 people were unjustly persecuted to death.
column2: 大約11,500人遭不公正地迫害致死。

column1: Yet, even during the most tumultuous times of the revolution, Shanghai was able to maintain economic production with positive annual growth rate.
column2: 然而，即使在革命最動盪的時期，上海經濟生產仍能保持正成長。

column1: Since 1949, Shanghai has been a comparatively heavy contributor of tax revenue to the central government; in 1983, the city's contribution in tax revenue was greater than investment received in the past 33 years combined.
column2: 自1949年以來，上海一直對中央政府稅收相對貢獻較高；1983年，上海在稅收貢獻，超過過去33年的投資總和。

column1: This came at the cost of the severely crippling welfare of Shanghainese people and Shanghai's infrastructural and capital development.
column2: 這是以嚴重犠牲上海人民福祉以及上海的基礎設施和資本發展為代價的。

column1: Its importance to the fiscal well-being of the central government also denied it from economic liberalizations begun in 1978.
column2: 它對中央政府財政收支的重要性，也讓上海無緣於1978年開始的經濟自由化。

column1: In 1990, Deng Xiaoping finally permitted Shanghai to initiate economic reforms, which reintroduced foreign capital to the city and developed the Pudong district, resulting in the birth of Lujiazui.
column2: 1990年，鄧小平終於批准上海啟動經濟改革，該市重新引進外資，並開發浦東區，導致陸家嘴誕生。

column1: Shanghai is located on the Yangtze Estuary of China's east coast, with the Yangtze River to the north and Hangzhou Bay to the south.
column2: 上海位於中國東海海岸的長江口，北邊是長江，南邊是杭州灣。

column1: The land is formed by the Yangtze's natural deposition and modern land reclamation projects.
column2: 這片土地是由長江的自然沉積以及當代土地開墾計畫形成的。

column1: As such, it has sandy soil, and skyscrapers are to be built with deep concrete piles to avoid sinking into the soft ground.
column2: 因此該地具有沙質土壤，摩天大樓採用深層混凝土樁建造，以免沉入鬆軟的地面。

column1: The provincial-level Municipality of Shanghai administers both the estuary and many of its surrounding islands.
column2: 省級的上海市政府，管理河口及其周圍的許多島嶼。

column1: It is roughly equidistant from Beijing and Guangzhou, bordering the East China Sea to the east, Zhejiang to the south, and Jiangsu to the west and north.
column2: 它與北京和廣州大致相當，東與東海接壤，南與浙江接壤，西側和北側與江蘇接壤。

column1: The municipality's northernmost point is on Chongming Island, which is the second-largest island in mainland China after its expansion during the 20th century.
column2: 20世紀市區擴大後，中國大陸第二大島崇明島成為該市最北端。

column1: However, it does not include an exclave of Jiangsu on northern Chongming or the two islands forming Shanghai's Yangshan Port, which are parts of Zhejiang's Shengsi County.
column2: 然而，它不包括崇明北部的江蘇飛地或形成上海洋山港的兩個島嶼，這兩個島嶼是浙江嵊泗縣的一部分。

column1: Shanghai is located on an alluvial plain.
column2: 上海位於沖積平原上。

column1: As such, the vast majority of its 6,340.5 km² (2,448.1 sq mi) land area is flat, with an average elevation of 4 m (13 ft).
column2: 因此，其6,340.5平方公里（2,448.1平方英里）的土地，絕大多數是平坦的，平均海拔為4米（13英尺）。

column1: The city's few hills, such as She Shan, lie to the southwest, and its highest point is the peak of Dajinshan Island (103 m or 338 ft) in Hangzhou Bay.
column2: 該市為數不多的山丘，如佘山，位於西南方向，其最高點是杭州灣大金山島（103米或338英尺）的山峰。

column1: Shanghai has many rivers, canals, streams, and lakes, and it is known for its rich water resources as part of the Lake Tai drainage basin.
column2: 上海有許多河流、運河、溪流和湖泊，屬於太湖流域的一部分，以豐富的水資源而聞名。

column1: Downtown Shanghai is bisected by the Huangpu River, a man-made tributary of the Yangtze created by order of Lord Chunshen during the Warring States period.
column2: 上海市中心被黃浦江一分為二，黃浦江是戰國時期春申君下令開挖的長江人造支流。

column1: The historic center of the city was located on the west bank of the Huangpu (Puxi), near the mouth of Suzhou Creek, connecting it with Lake Tai and the Grand Canal.
column2: 該市的歷史中心位於黃埔江西岸（浦西），靠近蘇州河口，連接太湖和大運河。

column1: The central financial district, Lujiazui, has been established on the east bank of the Huangpu (Pudong).
column2: 金融中心區陸家嘴位於黃埔江東岸（浦東）。

column1: Along Shanghai's eastern shore, the destruction of local wetlands due to the construction of Pudong International Airport has been partially offset by the protection and expansion of a nearby shoal, Jiuduansha, as a nature preserve.
column2: 沿著上海東岸，浦東國際機場的建設和擴張對當地濕地造成破壞，但附近九段沙自然保護區成立後破壞趨緩。

column1: Before the arrival of Han Chinese to Nantou, the Atayal, Bunun and Tsou tribes were distributed throughout the northern and central Nantou.
column2: 在漢人抵達南投之前，泰雅族、布農族和鄒族部落分佈在南投北部和中部。

column1: These groups pioneered the early development of mountain regions in Nantou.
column2: 這些族群促成南投山區的早期發展。

column1: In 1677, Lin Yi (Chinese: 林圯), a general under the command of Koxinga, led soldiers to establish residence in Shalianbao (modern-day Zhushan).
column2: 1677年，國姓爺統領下的將軍林圮，帶領士兵在沙連堡（今之竹山）駐紮。

column1: The Han Chinese began to enter Nantou via two main routes, the Zhuoshui River and Maoluo River.
column2: 漢人開始自兩條主要路線遷入南投，包括濁水溪與貓羅溪。

column1: In 1901, during Japanese rule, Nanto Chō (Japanese: 南投廳) was one of twenty local administrative offices established.
column2: 1901年，在日治期間，南投廳是20個地方行政單位之一。

column1: In 1909, part of Toroku Chō (斗六廳) was merged into Nanto Cho.
column2: 1909年，斗六廳的一部分併入南投廳。

column1: A major reorganization occurred in 1920, in which the area was administered under Taichū Prefecture together with modern-day Changhua County and Taichung City.
column2: 1920年有重大整併，該地區與今彰化縣和今臺中市，一同併入台中州治下。

column1: After the handover of Taiwan from Japan to the Republic of China on 25 October 1945, the present day area of Nantou County was administered under Taichung County of Taiwan Province.
column2: 1945年10月25日日本移交台灣給中華民國後，南投縣現今地區由臺灣省臺中縣管理。

column1: On 16 August 1950, Nantou County was established by its separation from Taichung County, and Nantou Township was designed as the county seat.
column2: 1950年8月16日，南投縣自臺中縣分出成立，以南投鎮為縣治。

column1: On 1 July 1957, the Zhongxing New Village in Nantou Township was designed to be the capital of Taiwan Province from the former Taipei City.
column2: 1957年7月1日，南投鎮中興新村取代台北，成為臺灣省會所在地。

column1: In 1981, the county seat was upgraded from Nantou Township to Nantou City.
column2: 1981年，縣治南投鎮升格為南投市。

column1: The Chi-Chi earthquake occurred in 1999.
column2: 集集大地震發生在1999年。

column1: Nantou County has an area of 4,106.436 km² (1,585.504 sq mi) with a width of 72 km (45 mi) and length of 95 km (59 mi).
column2: 南投縣面積為4,106.436平方公里（1,585.504平方英里），寬72公里（45英里），長95公里（59英里）。

column1: It is the second largest county in Taiwan after Hualien County.
column2: 它是臺灣僅次於花蓮縣的第二大縣。

column1: There are 41 mountains with peaks over 3,000 meters high, with Mount Yu in Xinyi Township is the highest peak in Nantou County and in Taiwan with a height of 3,952 meters.
column2: 有41座山峰超過3000米，信義區內的玉山，是南投縣與臺灣最高的山峰，高度為3952米。

column1: Around 83% of Nantou County area is covered by hills and mountains.
column2: 南投縣約83%為山地。

column1: Rain that falls into the mountains area converge into the Dadu River and Zhuoshui River.
column2: 落入山區的雨水，流入大肚溪和濁水溪。

column1: There are inland ponds and lakes throughout the mountains in the county, such as the Sun Moon Lake, Bi Pond, Liyu Pond and Cilin Pond.
column2: 縣內山區各地都有內陸池塘和湖泊，如日月潭、碧湖、鯉魚潭和麒麟潭。

column1: The annual average temperature in Nantou County is 23 °C on level ground and 20 °C on mountains.
column2: 南投縣的年平均氣溫為平地23°C，山區為20°C。

column1: The annual average rainfall is less than 1,750 mm on level ground and 2,800 mm on mountains.
column2: 平地的年平均降雨量不到1750毫米，山地年平均降雨量不到2800毫米。

column1: The rainy season lasts from April to September and the dry season lasts from October to March.
column2: 雨季從4月持續到9月，乾季從10月持續到3月。

column1: Nantou County consists of 1 city, 4 urban townships, 6 rural townships, 2 mountain indigenous townships, 128 villages and 133 neighborhoods.
column2: 南投縣由1個市、4個鎮、6個鄉、2個原住民鄉、128個村和133個里組成。

column1: Nantou City is the seat of the county which houses the Nantou County Government and Nantou County Council.
column2: 南投市是南投縣政府和南投縣議會的所在地。

column1: The incumbent Magistrate of Nantou County is Lin Ming-chen of the Kuomintang.
column2: 南投縣現任縣長是國民黨的林明溱。

column1: Nantou County voted two Kuomintang legislators out of two seats to be in the Legislative Yuan during the 2016 Republic of China legislative election.
column2: 在2016年中華民國立法委員選舉期間，南投縣從兩個席位中選出兩名國民黨立委參加立法院。

column1: Nantou County has a population of 517,037 people as of January 2014.
column2: 截至2014年1月，南投縣人口為517,037人。

column1: The official language of the county is Mandarin.
column2: 該縣的官方語言是國語。

column1: Taiwanese, Hakka, English and aboriginal languages are also spoken.
column2: 還講台語、客家語、英語和原住民語言。

column1: There are 2 colleges, 13 senior high and vocational schools, 30 junior high schools, 149 elementary schools, 106 kindergartens and 84 day care centers in the county.
column2: 該縣有2所大學、13所高中和職業學校、30所中學、149所小學、106所幼兒園和84個日間託嬰中心。

column1: Notable universities in the county are National Chi Nan University and Nan Kai University of Technology.
column2: 該縣著名的大學是國立暨南大學和私立南開科技大學。

column1: Nantou County houses Taiwan's first pumped-storage hydroelectric power plant, the Takuan Pumped Storage Hydro Power Plant commissioned in 1985 with an installed capacity of 1,008 MW.
column2: 南投縣擁有臺灣第一座抽蓄水力發電廠，明湖抽蓄水力發電廠於1985年啟用，裝置容量為1,008 MW。

column1: It also houses Taiwan's largest pumped-storage hydroelectric power plant, the Mingtan Pumped Storage Hydro Power Plant with an installed capacity of 1,602 MW.
column2: 另有臺灣最大的抽蓄水力發電廠，明潭抽蓄水力發電廠，裝置容量為1602 MW。

column1: Both power plants are located in Shueili Township along the Shuili River.
column2: 兩座發電廠都位於水里溪沿岸的水里鄉。

column1: Nantou County is served by the Jiji Line of Taiwan Railways which consists of Checheng, Jiji, Longquan, Shuili and Zhuoshui Station
column2: 南投縣有臺鐵集集線，該線設有車城、集集、龍泉、水里站和濁水站

column1: Originally in the territory of the Western Qiang peoples, Lanzhou became part of the territory of the State of Qin in the 6th century BC.
column2: 蘭州最初位在西方羌族的土地上，在公元前6世紀併入秦國領土。

column1: In 81 BC, under the Han dynasty (206 BC–AD 220), it was taken from the Huns' Huandi Chanyu and made the seat of Jincheng commandery (jùn), and later of the Jincheng county (xiàn), later renamed Yunwu.
column2: 公元前81年，在漢朝（公元前206年至公元220年）統治下，自匈奴壺衍鞮單于手中取得，成為金城郡，後來成為金城縣的所在地，後來更名為允吾。

column1: The city used to be called the Golden City, and since at least the first millennium BC it was a major link on the ancient Northern Silk Road, and also an important historic Yellow River crossing site.
column2: 這座城市曾經稱為金城，至少從公元前一千年開始，它是古代北方絲綢之路上的主要節點，也是史上重要的黃河渡口。

column1: To protect the city, the Great Wall of China was extended as far as Yumen.
column2: 為了保護這座城市，中國長城一直延伸到玉門。

column1: Parts of the Great Wall still exist within the built-up area.
column2: 一部分長城仍然存在於城區內。

column1: After the fall of the Han dynasty, Lanzhou became the capital of a succession of tribal states.
column2: 漢朝覆滅後，蘭州成為一系列部落國家的首府。

column1: In the 4th century it was briefly the capital of the independent state of Liang.
column2: 在4世紀，它短暫成為獨立王國梁的首都。

column1: The Northern Wei dynasty (386–534) reestablished Jincheng commandery, renaming the county Jincheng (金城 'Gold city).
column2: 北魏（386-534）重新設立金城郡，將金城縣更名為金城。

column1: Mixed with different cultural heritages, the area at present-day Gansu province, from the 5th to the 11th century, became a center for Buddhist study.
column2: 從5世紀到11世紀，今天的甘肅省地區混合了多元文化遺產，成為佛教研究中心。

column1: Under the Sui Dynasty (581–618) the city became the seat of Lanzhou prefecture for the first time, retaining this name under the Tang dynasty (618–907).
column2: 隋朝（581-618）時期，該市首次成為蘭州縣的所在地，在唐朝（618-907）時期保留了這個名字。

column1: In 763 the area was overrun by the Tibetan Empire and in 843 was conquered by the Tang.
column2: 763年，該地區被西藏王國佔領，843年由唐征服。

column1: Later it fell into the hands of the Western Xia dynasty (which flourished in Qinghai from the 11th to 13th century) and was subsequently absorbed by the Song dynasty (960–1126) in 1041.
column2: 後來，它落入西夏王朝（11世紀至13世紀在青海蓬勃發展）手中，隨後於1041年由宋朝（960-1126）併入。

column1: The name Lanzhou was reestablished, and the county renamed Lanzhuan.
column2: 蘭州此名重獲確立，該縣更名為 Lanzhuan。

column1: After 1127 it fell into the hands of the Jin dynasty, and after 1235 it came into the possession of the Mongol Empire.
column2: 1127年後，它落入金朝手中，1235年後落入蒙古帝國手中。

column1: Under the Ming dynasty (1368–1644) the prefecture was demoted to a county and placed under the administration of Lintao superior prefecture, but in 1477 Lanzhou was reestablished as a political unit.
column2: 在明朝（1368-1644年）時期，該縣被降級為郡，並由臨洮縣管理，但在1477年，蘭州重新成為行政區。

column1: The city acquired its current name in 1656, during the Qing dynasty.
column2: 這座城市於1656年清朝時期改為今名。

column1: When Gansu was made a separate province in 1666, Lanzhou became its capital.
column2: 甘肅於1666年獨立設省，蘭州成為其首府。

column1: In 1739 the seat of Lintao was transferred to Lanzhou, which was later made a superior prefecture called Lanzhou.
column2: 1739年，臨洮縣治轉移到蘭州，蘭州後來成為一個名為蘭州的上級單位。

column1: Lanzhou was badly damaged during the Dungan revolt in 1864–1875.
column2: 蘭州在1864-1875年的陝甘回亂嚴重受損。

column1: In the 1920s and 1930s it became a center of Soviet influence in northwestern China.
column2: 在1920年代和1930年代，它成為蘇聯發揮在中國西北部影響力的中心。

column1: During the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937–1945) Lanzhou, linked with Xi'an by highway in 1935, became the terminus of the 3,200 km (2,000 mi) Chinese–Soviet highway, used as a route for Soviet supplies destined for the Xi'an area.
column2: 在第二次中日戰爭（1937-1945年）期間，蘭州於1935年透過公路與西安相連，成為長達3200公里（2000英里）的中蘇公路的終點站，成為蘇聯物資運往西安地區的供給線。

column1: This highway remained the primary traffic route of northwestern China until the completion of the railway from Lanzhou to Ürümqi, Xinjiang.
column2: 在蘭州到新疆烏魯木齊的鐵路完工之前，這條公路一直是中國西北部的主要交通路線。

column1: During the war Lanzhou was heavily bombed by the Imperial Japanese Air Force.
column2: 戰爭期間，蘭州遭到日本帝國空軍的猛烈轟炸。

column1: During the 1937 Japanese invasion of China, the Guominjun Muslim Generals Ma Hongkui and Ma Bufang protected Lanzhou with their cavalry troops, putting up such resistance that the Japanese never captured Lanzhou.
column2: 1937年日本入侵中國期間，國民黨軍穆斯林將軍馬洪奎和馬布芳用騎兵部隊保護蘭州，進行大規模抵抗，因此日本人從未佔領過蘭州。

column1: The city is the seat of a currently vacant Roman Catholic diocese and was previously the center of a vicariate apostolic (Vicariate Apostolic of Northern Kan-Su).
column2: 這座城市是一個目前教主懸缺的羅馬天主教教區所在地，以前是宗座代牧區（北甘肅宗座代牧區）的中心。

column1: The city is located in a narrow and curved river valley with surrounding mountains causing it to be hemmed in blocking a free flow of air.
column2: 這座城市位於一個狹窄而彎曲的河谷中，周圍有山脈，阻擋空氣自由流動。

column1: Not long ago, Lanzhou repeatedly had the worst air quality of any of 84 Chinese cities surveyed.
column2: 不久前，蘭州的空氣品質往往是84個中國城市中最差的城市。

column1: According to the National Environmental Analysis released by Tsinghua University and The Asian Development Bank in January 2013, Lanzhou was among one of ten most air polluted cities in the world.
column2: 根據清華大學和亞洲開發銀行2013年1月發表的國家環境分析報告，蘭州是世界上空氣汙染最嚴重的十個城市之一。

column1: Air quality reportedly was so poor that at times one could not see Lanshan, the mountain rising up along the south side of the city.
column2: 據報導，空氣品質非常差，有時看不到沿著城市南側抬升的蘭山。

column1: Lanzhou is also the home of many factories, including some involved in petroleum processing, and suffers from large dust storms kicked up from the Gobi Desert, especially in the winter and spring.
column2: 蘭州也是許多工廠的所在地，包括一些石油化工廠，同時也受戈壁沙漠掀起的大型沙塵暴影響，尤其是在冬季和春季。

column1: In 2011, using Chinese statistics, the World Health Organization reported that Lanzhou had the worst air quality (annual mean PM10 ug/m3 of 150) among eleven western Chinese cities, and was worse than Beijing with its reading of 121.
column2: 2011年，世界衛生組織使用中國統計資料報告稱，在中國西部11個城市中，蘭州的空氣品質最差（年均PM10 為150微克/立方公尺），比指數為121的北京差。

column1: Since then, authorities have taken measures to improve air quality, which have largely been successful. "Thirteen polluting enterprises with excessive capacity have been closed, more than 200 highly polluting enterprises were suspended in winter, and 78 industrial enterprises have moved to an industrial park outside the city." In 2015 it was awarded China's climate progress title.
column2: 之後當局採取措施改善空氣品質，可算成功。「13家產能過大的汙染企業已停工，200多家高汙染企業在冬季停工，78家工廠已遷到城外的工業區。2015年，該市獲得中國氣候進步稱號。

column1: As a city once unable to be spotted from satellites, Lanzhou has taken various measures to combat air pollution in recent years, having reduced its Air Pollution Index at the fastest speed across China.
column2: 蘭州過去曾經無法從衛星上看見，近年來採取了各種措施來對應空氣汙染，和中國各地相比，以最快的速度降低了空氣汙染指數。

column1: According to the 2018 WHO database, of 2700 towns listed, Lanzhou has the 158th highest level of PM 2.5 pollution, with an average of 54 micrograms per cubic meter (twice that of Milan).
column2: 根據2018年世衛組織資料庫，表列的2700個城鎮中，蘭州的PM 2.5汙染水準位居第158位，平均每立方米54微克（是米蘭的兩倍）。

column1: The large particle PM10 remains high, at 132 micrograms per cubic meter, in part as a result of sand storms.
column2: 較大微粒PM10仍然很高，為每立方米132微克，部分源於沙塵暴。

column1: The reach of the Yellow River at Lanzhou carries a high load of silt, giving the river its characteristic muddy appearance; however water quality in this reach is better than the "fetid outflow that barely passes for water two hours downstream" (2008).
column2: 黃河在蘭州的延伸處帶來大量淤泥，使這條河具有獨特的泥濘外觀；然而，這一延伸處的水質優於下游處，因為下游「兩小時內幾乎只有汙物流出，沒有水」（2008年）。

column1: In recent years, several specimens of the endangered Chinese giant salamander have been found in and near the Yellow River in Lanzhou.
column2: I近年來，在蘭州段黃河及其附近發現了幾種瀕危的中國巨型蠑螈。

column1: On April 11, 2014 Lanzhou officials advised residents not to drink tap water, because benzene levels were 20 times the national limit of 10 micrograms per liter.
column2: 2014年4月11日，蘭州官員建議居民不要喝自來水，因為苯含量是全國每公升10微克限制的20倍。

column1: The city water supply suspected industrial chemical production to be the culprit, similar to what happened in 2005 Jilin chemical plant explosions.
column2: 化工產品可能是該市供水汙染的主因，類似於2005年吉林化工廠爆炸案。

column1: Lanzhou experiences earthquakes regularly, although usually at low intensities.
column2: 蘭州經常發生地震，不過震度通常很低。

column1: In 1920 a large earthquake was experienced killing more than 100,000 people in Ningxia and Eastern Gansu province, although only 42 were killed in Lanzhou itself, the low number being attributed to the strong yet flexible nature of the wooden buildings in the city.
column2: 1920年，寧夏和甘肅東部省發生大地震，造成超過十萬人死亡；但日是蘭州本身只有42人死亡，由於該市木製建築強韌而靈活，因此死傷不多。

column1: The 14,000-capacity Northwest University for Nationalities Stadium is one of the main sports venues in the city.
column2: 可容納14,000人的西北民族大學體育場是該市的主要體育場地之一。

column1: It is mostly used for football games.
column2: 主要用於足球比賽。

column1: A new sports center complex, including a stadium with a capacity of 60,000 spectators and a swimming hall, is under development.
column2: 正在興建一個新的綜合運動中心，包括可容納6萬名觀眾的體育場和游泳館。

column1: Lanzhou previously had a professional soccer team named Gansu Tianma F.C. from 1999 to 2003.
column2: 從1999年到2003年，蘭州曾有一支名為甘肅天馬足球俱樂部的職業足球隊。

column1: The team played in Chinese Football Association Yi League from 1999 to 2001 and bought a position in the Jia League from Tianjin Lifei.
column2: 該隊從1999年到2001年在職業乙級聯賽踢球，並向天津立飛購得甲級聯賽的資格。

column1: The team relocated to Ningbo, Zhejiang and changed their name to Ningbo Yaoma (宁波耀马) in 2003.
column2: 該團隊於2003年遷至浙江寧波，並更名為寧波耀馬。

column1: The team later relegated to the Yi League in 2004 and sold to Dongguan Dongcheng, who moved the club to the Hong Kong First Division League.
column2: 該隊後來於2004年降級至乙級聯賽，並賣給東莞東城，東莞東城將俱樂部轉移到香港甲級聯賽。

column1: Former England international Paul Gascoigne played four games in both a playing and coaching role for Gansu in 2003, scoring two goals, before returning to England after falling out with the club, as his mental state meant that he had to return to America for treatment against drink and depression.
column2: 2003年，前英格蘭國腳 Paul Gascoigne 在甘肅共有四場比賽擔任球員兼教練，踢進兩球，然後在與俱樂部爭吵後返回英格蘭，因為他的精神狀態使他必須回美國接受戒酒和抑鬱症治療。

column1: On August 20, 2012, Lanzhou New Area was approved by the State Council of China's Central Government as the fifth state-level new special economic development zone (followed by Pudong of Shanghai, Binhai of Tianjin, Liangjiang of Chongqing, Zhoushan of Zhejiang), which is also the first state-level new area in the northwest of China.
column2: 2012年8月20日，蘭州新區被中國中央政府國務院批准為第五個國家級新經濟特區（其次是上海浦東、天津濱海、重慶兩江、浙江舟山），也是中國西北部第一個國家級新區。

column1: The area has been described as a ghost town, as it has failed to attract anywhere close to the anticipated number of inhabitants.
column2: 該地區被稱為鬼城，因為它完全不具備能吸引接近預期居民人數的特色。

column1: Since 1949 Lanzhou has been transformed from the capital of a poverty-stricken province into the center of a major industrial area.
column2: 自1949年以來，蘭州已從貧困省的首府，轉變為主要工業區的中心。

column1: The GDP per capita of Lanzhou was 25,566 (RMB) (US$3,681) in 2008, ranking it at number 134 among 659 Chinese cities.
column2: 2008年，蘭州人均國內生產毛額為25,566元（3,681美元），在中國659個城市中排名第134位。

column1: In 2015, the GDP per capita had grown to 57,191 RMB (US$9182.28) and the city ranked at place 100 for total GDP of Chinese cities.
column2: 2015年，人均國內生產毛額增長到57,191元人民幣（9182.28美元），該市在中國城市總GDP中排名第100位。

column1: The International Solar Energy Center (UNIDO-ISEC) is located in Lanzhou's Chengguan district.
column2: 國際太陽能中心（UNIDO-ISEC）位於蘭州城關區。

column1: Main industries include textile mills, rubber processing and fertilizer plants, an oil refinery, petrochemicals, machinery, and metallurgical industry.
column2: 主要行業包括紡織廠、橡膠加工和化肥廠、煉油廠、石化產品、機械和冶金行業。

column1: Gansu has one of the largest oil refineries in the country and Lanzhou itself is the center of the province's petrochemical industry.
column2: 甘肅擁有全國最大的煉油廠之一，蘭州本身就是該省石化業中心。

column1: The refinery is linked to the fields at Yumen by pipeline.
column2: 煉油廠透過輸油管線與玉門的油田相連。

column1: It also manufactures equipment for the oil industry.
column2: 也製造石化產業設備。

column1: Lanzhou has a large textile industry, particularly noted for the production of woolen and leather goods.
column2: 蘭州擁有大規模紡織業，尤其以生產羊毛和皮革製品而聞名。

column1: In addition, Lanzhou produces locomotives and rolling stock for the northwestern railways, as well as machine tools and mining equipment.
column2: 此外，蘭州生產西北鐵道使用的火車頭和火車車輛，還有機具和採礦裝置。

column1: Aluminum products, industrial chemicals, and fertilizers are produced on a large scale, and there is a large rubber industry.
column2: 大規模生產鋁製品、工業化學品和化肥，也有大型橡膠產業。

column1: Copper is mined in nearby Gaolan.
column2: 在附近的𦤑蘭開採銅礦。

column1: Lanzhou has been one of the centers of China's national nuclear power industry since the 1960s.
column2: 自1960年代以來，蘭州一直是中國國家核電產業的中心之一。

column1: Lanzhou Zhongchuan Airport is the main airport serving Lanzhou, it is located 70 km (43 mi) north of Lanzhou.
column2: 蘭州中川機場是蘭州的主要機場，位於蘭州以北70公里（43英里）。

column1: It opened for public service in 1970.
column2: 於1970年啟用。

column1: The airport offers direct connections to over 70 international and domestic destinations.
column2: 該機場可直達70多個國際和國內航點。

column1: Lanzhou was the second city in northwest China to announce the construction of a subway line, in August 2012.
column2: 2012年8月，蘭州是中國西北部第二個宣佈興建捷運的城市。

column1: The urban railway network, Lanzhou Metro, is planned to consist of six subway lines running 207 km (129 mi).
column2: 城市地鐵網「蘭州捷運」由六條捷運線組成，長207公里（129英里）。

column1: The first line, which is completely underground, opened in June 2019.
column2: 第一條線路完全地下化，於2019年6月開通。

column1: New high-speed passenger-only railways are completed both toward the east (the Xuzhou–Lanzhou high-speed railway) and the west (the Lanzhou–Xinjiang high-speed railway).
column2: 新建完成兩條客運高鐵：東部（徐州-蘭州高速鐵路）和西部（蘭州-新疆高速鐵路）。

column1: These services only stop at Lanzhou West Railway Station.
column2: 高鐵只停靠蘭州西站。

column1: The Zhongwei–Lanzhou high-speed railway and Chengdu–Lanzhou high-speed railway was under construction.
column2: 中衛-蘭州高速鐵路和成都-蘭州高速鐵路正在建設中。

column1: Lanzhou forms an important link in one of the routes of the Eurasian Land Bridge and also provides rail access to Qinghai, Xinjiang and Tibet further to the west.
column2: 蘭州是歐亞陸橋其中一條路線的重要節點，可通往更西邊的青海、新疆和西藏的鐵路通道。

column1: A large rail freight terminal has recently been constructed to accommodate increasing volumes of rail freight and Lanzhou is home to China's fourth largest marshalling yard.
column2: 最近興建一個大型鐵路貨運站，以容納越來越多的鐵路貨運量，蘭州是中國第四大調車場的所在地。

column1: Regular freight services connect Lanzhou to destinations including Chongqing, Hamburg, Almaty and Kathmandu.
column2: 定期貨運服務將蘭州與包括重慶、漢堡、阿拉木圖和加德滿都在內的目的地連線起來。

column1: In 2016, Lanzhou was ranked 4th of Chinese cities with the worst rush hour traffic jams.
column2: 2016年，蘭州在交通尖峰時段交通堵塞最嚴重的中國城市中排名第四。

column1: However, by 2017, it dropped to 33rd place.
column2: 然而，到2017年，它下降到第33位。

column1: Lanzhou has a noted bus rapid transit system which opened in 2013 and won the city an honorable mention at the 2014 Sustainable Transport Awards.
column2: 蘭州於 2013 年啟用了著名的快速公車運輸系統，該市因而獲頒 2014 年永續交通獎的榮銜。

column1: Other services connect to local and provincial areas.
column2: 其他服務將地方和省級地區相連。

column1: An in 2014 inaugurated bike sharing system covers mostly the Chengguan District with 377 stations.
column2: 2014年啟動的公共腳踏車系統主要服務城關區，有377個取車點。

column1: The system had a successful start and the number of stations is being expanded.
column2: 該系統已成功啟用，車站數量正在擴增。

column1: However, vandalism proved to be a problem, with 600 (out of a total of 6,500) bikes a year not being returned to the stations.
column2: 然而，事實證明破壞是一個問題；每年有600輛腳踏車（總共6500輛）沒有返回車站。

column1: As bikes are not rented out anymore late at night, people reportedly outed their frustration on the bikes in the case they were too late to rent one.
column2: 由於腳踏車在深夜時無法租用，據報，因為太晚無法租車，有人在腳踏車上洩憤。

column1: The city is the seat of Lanzhou University, founded in 1909.
column2: 該市是蘭州大學於1909年成立的所在地。

column1: The National Minorities Institute at Lanzhou and a branch of the Chinese Academy of Sciences are also located in the city.
column2: 蘭州少數民族研究所和中國科學院的一個分院也位於該市。

column1: In particular, Northwest Normal University has been the key university at the provincial level, which has prepared over 100,000 teachers in schools across the province Gansu.
column2: 尤其是，西北師範大學一直是省級的重要大學，為甘肅省各級學校培養了超過10萬名教師。
